betterquesting:10.desc:8:
Welcome to §9§9§9§b§b§b§b§b§b§l§l§l§l§l§lSupersymmetry§r§r§r§r§r§r! 

You have just landed on an unfamiliar planet. This book will teach you how to rebuild civilization from scratch in only §k4200§r pages.

Start by getting a rock§r. This book is interactive.

When you pick up a rock from the ground, press the §l§l§l§l§l§l§a§a§a§a§a§aSUBMIT§r button to complete the quest and continue.

If you lose this book, you can check the quests by pressing the §2§aGRAVE §rkey.

Pages that have a normal icon aren't required for progression. 
Pages that have a framed icon, like this one are §crequired §rand contain critical information for your survival.

You have been given a §6home block§r. It allows you to set your spawn if you ever die. You cannot skip the night, as beds are not available before EV.

It is probably impossible to try to play GregTech without using JEI. So here are some tips on how to use JEI to its full potential.

This pack will assume that the player's IQ is above 100. If you are confused, press §6R §ron an item in the questbook to see the item's crafting recipe, or §6U §rto see its uses.

§eBookmark items regularly§r (default key §aA§r) so you don't have to type the names over and over.

Most of the items have §emultiple recipes§r! Dont stop at the first recipe and think that item is impossible.
Sometimes a material is only available from §etiny dusts§r, sometimes it's available from a §efluid solution§r. It takes some practice. Oil processing and nuclear chemistry are pretty bad about this.

You can §epress @§r to see only items from that mod. For example, if you search for §c@gregtech§r, you will only see items from GregTech.

You can §epress $ §rto see only items from a specific entry in the Ore Dictionary. For example, if you search for §c$logWood§r, you will only see wooden logs.

You can §epress U §ron an item to see its uses.
betterquesting:10.name:8: It's JEI, not NEI. Use it wisely.

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
You are only able to grow some crops in certain seasons (but you can change that using a §agreenhouse§r, or with automated farming), and the environment around you will change throughout the year.

§aSpring §rstarts on March 1 and ends on May 30.
§6Summer §rstarts on June 1 and ends on August 30.
§cAutumn §rstarts on September 1 and ends on November 30.
§bWinter §rstarts on December 1 and ends on February 30.

Flint shards§r are needed to get yourself some tools. 

Gravel can be mined without a tool, and enables you to acquire flint.

Flint can be knapped [§aRight Click while looking at the top side of stone§r] on an exposed stone surface, obtaining flint shards.
The Akashic Tome is a compendium of several other guidebooks that might be useful for you. You can get it for free by clicking the checkbox.

Your new §eFlint Knife § can be used for cutting things,§f making things into shards, or getting §aplant fibers§r§..

To cut items other than blocks, you need to have the item you want to cut in your §0§aoffhand,§r and the knife in your §amain hand.§r This works vice versa.

You can also use the flint knife as a weapon.

You can use your shiny new §eflint knife§r to make plant fibers. 

You can get §aplant fibers§r by breaking §2tall grass §ror §2leaves§r with your flint knife.
You can then pack those §aplant fibers§r into §aplant string§r.
Construct a §6Flint Hatchet§r using flint and plant fibers. As the name implies, it can cut down trees.
betterquesting:10.name:8: The part where you get wood

betterquesting:10.desc:8: You can use flint to develop new §6weapons§r. All you can make right now are a bow and an arrow, but they'll suffice for now.
Using our §6crafting table §ryou can now construct better tools, a §6flint pickaxe §rfor mining ores and a §6flint shovel §rfor digging sand or gravel.

There are many useful resources underground, so you should be looking around for them. 

Something you need to look for is §l§amagnetite§r. It will be used in the construction of magnets later.

Magnetite is found in ore deposits§a §runderground. Ore deposits are about 20 x 20 meters in size.

If you see a §atiny pile of magnetite §ron the surface, it will indicate that there is a deposit underground. 


Ore deposits can be found every 50 meters or so in each direction. If you are above an ore deposit, you will see metal rocks on the ground and an indicator on the top left of the screen.

§6Leather §rneeds to be boiled to make §6Treated Leather§r, and then bound together with string to make §bBound Leather§r.

You can craft the armor with §9Bound Leather in a Crafting Table.

The furnace §ris a very primitive smelting device that allows you to cook things up to a temperature that is just enough to smelt copper, lead §rand §7tin§.§r.

§rMore information on finding these ores is on the next page.
For now you can just make the furnace.

Copper is found in §6Chalcopyrite, Chalcocite, Malachite, Bornite, Tetrahedrite, §ror §6Copper Ore§r deposits. Copper can be found pretty much everywhere in the Earth's crust, and even in the deeper layers.

If you are having trouble finding a specific deposit, look it up in the JEI database, you will find a page showing where it is found. 

Let's start by getting 20 copper ingots.

Finding a §6Tiny Pile of Copper Dust §ron the ground means that there is a deposit under it.

Tin can be found in §6Cassiterite Sand§r, §6Cassiterite Ore§r§r§r, §rand §6Tin Ore§r deposits. You can look them up in the JEI database to see where you can find them.

Tin is a silvery-coloured metal. Tin is soft enough to be cut with little force and a bar of tin can be bent with little effort. 
§6
§l§rOre deposits cover a surface of 20 by 20 meters across. Each deposit can contain up to 5,000 ingots worth of ore.
The §amortar§r§r can be used for crushing ores and ingots into §bdusts§r. You can use stone and flint to make it.

§6Bronze§r is an alloy consisting of 75% copper combined with about 25% tin.

Mix the dusts in a §acrafting table§r in a 3 to 1 ratio to make §6bronze dust§r. Then you must smelt it in a furnace to get bronze ingots.

Crafting the dusts by hand will only yield 3 §6bronze dust§r per batch. However, you can craft 4 with the same amount later on using a §6Mixer§f. By using an §6Alloy Furnace§r, you can obtain the same yield efficiencies while not needing to grind the ingots to dust.

§3This will unlock Tier 1.

Nights are dark and extremely dangerous on most planets known to support life, seek shelter as soon as possible.

If you go outside, you may notice that there are several entities around you. At this stage you are nowhere near ready for killing any of them, so§c you must hide. §r

A grindstone can be used for extracting more metal out of your ores. It's not that good... but it's a start. It's also §cmanual§r, so you have to power it using your hands.

Put a §6Wooden Crank §ron top of the grindstone and §aright click §ron it to rotate it. After a few rotations, the ore will have turned into crushed ores.

Putting 2 ore in results in an output of 3 crushed ores. 

These crushed ores can then be smelted into ingots, or processed further to get things such as §bImpure Ore Dusts§f or §bCentrifuged Ores§f to get more value out of your ores.
Breaking leaves§r with a piece of Flint§r or a Flint Knife will drop a stick. However, Flint Shards will not work.

The §7Coke Oven §ris a hollow 3x3x3 structure made of Coke Bricks with a Coke Oven Controller in the center.
It turns §7Coal §rinto §7Coal Coke§r, and Logs into Charcoal.

Coal Coke burns longer in furnaces, and in small coal boilers. 

The Coke Oven also produces Creosote Oil, which can be used either as furnace fuel or for creating§6 Treated Wood §rblcoks.

§rMore advanced tools will be needed to progress towards the Industrial Age. There are six major types of tools.

§6§lBronze tools should be made first, since you are quite a bit away from iron.§r 

The §2hammer §ris used kind of everywhere. It's used to make all the other tools and it turns ingots into plates
The §2file§r turns ingots into rods.
The §2saw §rturns wood planks into slabs, and turns logs into 6 planks.
The §2screwdriver§r is used in most recipes and in setting up covers. It also makes important parts like gears and rotors.
The §2wrench§r is used in cutting pipes and it's probably the most important tools out of all of them.
The §2wire cutter§r cuts wiring.

§l§c§lBoth JEI and the book will show iron tools wherever tools are used. Tools other than iron will not show up in the JEI search. Bronze tools exist and should be made first. Generally, recipes accept all kinds of tools.§r

A furnace is not really good for smelting items. Its maximum temperature is only 1000 K (730°C), which is not hot enough for iron.

A Primitive Blast Furnace is made out of 32 §cFirebricks§r and 1 §4Primitive Blast Furnace Controller§r. It's a  §a3x4x3 structure§r§r of firebricks that is hollowed out in the middle. For more help, look at the §cStructure Preview§r in the JEI database.

The Primitive Blast Furnace can smelt iron, wrought iron and §bsteel§r. It has a maximum temperature of about 1400 K (1,127°C).

Like many other structures, it is possible to share the walls of multiple Primitive Blast Furnaces and they will still work.

§7Sphalerite §rveins contain §7sphalerite ore§r, an important source of zinc. It's found on Earth at altitude 0 to 60, but also in the deepest part of the crust.

Zinc is a slightly brittle metal at room temperature and has a shiny-greyish appearance.

Zinc will be used to create magnets, but if you can't find zinc, §amagnetite ore §rcan be used instead.

To make magnets, you must have a §bVoltaic Pile§r. §c
§r
A Voltaic Pile is made of three components: a §6Copper Plate§r, a §7Zinc Plate§r, and Electrolyte Paper.

A common electrolyte is §6citric acid§r. Putting lemons, limes, or oranges with paper will create electrolyte paper. Limes can be found in jungles, lemons can be found in jungle edges and forests, while oranges can be found in savannah biomes. 

If you can't get a hold of a voltaic pile, you can use another method for magnetizing an iron rod, using §6magnetite§r.

§7Iron §ris the most common element on planet Earth. It is used for refining it into §6steel§r [see the next page] and for basic tools. It is one of the most important metals of the Industrial Age.

Extracting usable metal from iron ores requires kilns or furnaces (such as a §cBlast Furnace§r) capable of reaching 1,500 °C (1,773K) or higher, about 500 °C higher than that required to smelt copper.

To start, you will need an §ciron rod§r - make an ingot of iron into a rod (with the file), then put it in a furnace.

There are two ways of making magnets:

- Putting a hot iron rod with a §cmagnetite chunk§r in a crafting table, 
- or using the §cvoltaic pile §ralong with some §ccopper fine wire§r (you need special equipment though).§ 

This process is only done once§r. A newly-formed §cmagnetic iron rod § can be used to magnetise other hot iron rods so don't throw it out!

§3This will unlock the Industrial Age.
§7Magnetite §rores can be broken up into §7magnetite chunks§r by using a Crafting Table. They can be used to magnetize an §6iron rod§r.

We can make better tools out of §6bronze§r. You need to make the tool parts first, and then assemble the tool.

The bronze axe can cut down entire trees with just one click.

The bronze mining hammer can mine an entire 3x3 meter area with one click, unless you're pressing §aSHIFT§r.

The bronze spade does the same thing as the mining hammer, except it works with blocks which work with shovels, such as dirt and sand.

§c§lBoth JEI and the book will show iron tools wherever tools are used. Tools other than iron will not show up in the JEI search. Bronze tools exist and should be made first. Generally, recipes accept all kinds of tools.§r
Use your new alloy to make a §6bronze sword§r.

§6Steel§r is an alloy of iron and carbon with §6improved strength§r and fracture resistance compared to other forms of iron.

A §cPrimitive Blast Furnace §rcan turn iron ingots into §l§esteel§r, by smelting them with coal coke. 

Making steel is one of the top priorities of the Industrial Age. Make sure to have your Primitive Blast Furnace running at all times, or try to make 4 Primitive Blast Furnaces sharing their walls.

The goals for the Industrial Age is to obtain steam machines, making vacuum tubes and getting electricity.

The following information will be critical to your survival, so read it carefully!


§l§nHow do I get steam?§r

There are different ways to produce steam, there is the §c§cCoal Boiler§r,§c Lava Boiler§r, the §cSolar Boiler§r, and the §cLarge Boilers§r. A good option right now is the Coal Boiler.

The Coal Boiler is powered by §cfurnace fuels§r and is extremely fuel efficient. It will take some time to heat up, and once hot enough it will §c§rconsume water§r and §c§rautomatically output steam§r into connected pipes. Remember that boilers can §4§l§nexplode§r when they're already hot, have no water and you add some water.

§l§nHow do Steam machines work?§r

§n§l§rSteam machines are §6slow§r, §6need pipe connection§r, and §6do not auto-output§r.
They also have an §6exhaust vent§r, represented by a gray square on their backside by default. 
This vent can be moved using a wrench, but §6must remain unblocked§r. 
When a recipe is completed, the vent will start shooting steam particles in the air, and if you're standing near the vent, you will be §c§lboiled alive

§l§nI'm still confused!
§rWatch this video if you need some help: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CR3KGYtaEtM

§r------------------------------------
§3CHAPTER 1 - STARTING A REVOLUTION
§r------------------------------------
§r- Industrialize
- Use the power of steam
- Start producing electricity
- Create the most basic electronics

Tier : 1 
EU/t : 0 
------------------------------------

The §l§rSteam Alloy Smelter §rdirectly combines dusts or ingots into §c§lnew alloys.

§rThis machine requires a fair amount of steam to work. If it ever runs out of steam, the machine can be turned off with a §aSoft Hammer§r.

The §6Alloy Smelter§r can make bronze directly, using §dingots§o§o§r, dusts, or even nuggets.§r You can make a nugget mold as well to turn ingots into nuggets. 

NOTE: Like all steam machines, the output port doubles as a steam outlet when recipes complete. §cIt must not be blocked§r. Also, steam is hot and can damage you if touched. Change the output side by whacking the Alloy Smelter with a wrench.

The §6Steam Macerator §ris used to convert ores into crushed ores. This is the most simple way of doing ore processing.

Every ore put into the Steam Macerator turns into 2 crushed ores, that can be smelted in the Furnace or PBFto get two ingots.

§6Molds§o§r can be used in the alloy smelter and the fluid solidifier. You need them to make vacuum tubes.
They can be used for turning dusts into ingots, or ingots into gears, using the alloy smelter.§r

The creation of §6Rubber §ris a very important step for any aspiring technician. Later on, rubber allows you to create circuitry.
Rubber is made from §5§6Latex§r, a fluid which is collected by putting a §6Steam Latex Collector §rnear a Rubber Tree. 

Make sure that the Collector is touching a Rubber Log on the §6white §rside of the machine.

The §7LV Conveyor Module §ris the fourth machine component you will need. 

It can be also used as a cover to move items around. 

The Conveyor Module, when placed on a machine, will transfer items to the block adjacent to the face it’s on. You can configure it to import or export items from the machine or item pipe you place it on.

Voltages are irrelevant when placing covers on machines, so, for example, you can safely put an LV conveyor module on HV machines and vice versa.

§d§rNickel is a silvery-white lustrous metal with a slight golden tinge. It is a hard and ductile transition metal. 

§e§dNickel§r is found in §6Garnierite§r, §6Pentlandite§r, §6§rand §6Nickel §rores. They are found in the second layer of Earth's crust, called "The Beneath" by villagers.

Mining deeper in the crust requires special equipment. Check the Exploration chapter for more info.
 §r
Nickel will be required for the production of §6electricity§r.

The §6Steam Roaster §rburns chemicals using steam. It's a reaction furnace. This machine will be used for the production of §6sulfur§r. The Roaster will be used in many chemical processes in LV and onwards.
The §aSteam Compressor §rcompresses things. It can turn ingots into blocks, as well as nuggets to ingots.

The §l§r§6Steam Forge Hammer §ris an extremely useful machine that will do pretty much anything that requires a hammer.

It can make §6plates §r§l§rat a better ratio, only requiring 1.5 ingots instead of 2 per plate. This can allow you to save a substantial amount of ingots until you acquire the §6bender§r, which requires only 1 ingot per plate.
The §6Vulcanizing Press§r turns Latex into Rubber plates. It requires §6Sulfur§r. The reaction may take a long time but it can be sped up by using §6Magnesia §ror §6Zincite§r as a catalyst.

§cRed Alloy§r is a highly conductive alloy made out of redstone and §ecopper§r. It can only be made in the alloy smelter.

You can find §4Redstone Ore §rin at altitude levels 15 to 35. If you find redstone rocks on the surface, this means that there will be a deposit underground.
The main objective of the Industrial Age is §evacuum tubes§r. Our first step is making §aglass tubes§r, with a ball mold and glass dust.

§6Pyrite §rcan be obtained by digging in §6Galena §ror §6Sphalerite §rdeposits, found in the first two layers of the crust.

Pyrite §6dust §rcan be roasted to obtain Banded Iron dust and elemental §6Sulfur§r, which will be used in processing rubber.
Banded Iron can be roasted again to obtain §6Sulfur Trioxide§r.

The §7§6Steam Mixer §rmixes several dusts or fluids together. It will be required for mixing Sulfur Trioxide and Water to create H2SO4. 

If some mixer recipes require a §6programmed circuit§r, you can §aclick §ron the "G" in the bottom right of the Mixer to change the configuration.

Sulfur Trioxide and Water can be mixed together to create §6Sulfuric Acid§r.

SO3 + H2O -> H2SO4

Since §6Sulfuric Acid §ris an acid, it will require §6special equipment §rto handle it. §c§lBuckets or Bronze/Steel Drums can't handle Acids. §rYou must use a §c§lLead Drum §rto transport Sulfuric Acid, as it's acid-proof.
The §7LV Bending Machine §ris a better method for making Plates and Foils. It processes §61 Ingot into 1 Plate§r, unlike the Steam Forge Hammer which processed 3 Ingots into 2 Plates.
Use the Vulcanizing Press to create §6Rubber Sheets.

The§6 Coagulation Tank§r is a hollow, 3x3x3 cubic structure that coagulates fluids into solids.

The Coagulation Tank requires:
§6- 1 Coagulation Tank Controller
- 24 Wooden Coagulation Tank Wall
§r
The tank can coagulate liquid Latex into a solid hunk of Latex. 
Some fluid §6Catalysts§r can be used to make the process faster, but it requires that Circuits are supplied to the machine, so this isn't available right now. 

Input and Output §6buses §rare required to transport items in and out of a multiblock machine.
Input and Output §6hatches §rcan transport fluids in and out of a machine.

While this machine isn't strictly required, it makes the next step of the Rubber processing chain about §c8x more efficient§r.

§6Wires §rcan be insulated with §6Rubber §sto create Cables. Cables don't have a lot of §6Energy Loss§r, and, unlike wires, you won't get damaged if you touch them.
These will be required in the creation of circuits.

§6LV Electric Motors §rare one of the most important components in electric machines, but they are also required to make §6pistons§r.

While you'll only need a few of these in the Industrial Age, once you get to the Electric Age you will require hundreds of pistons. You can batch craft 16 or more Pistons at a time to reduce the pain.
The §6LV Electric Piston§r is also another important component of electric machines, but it will be required to make the Steam Macerator and Forge Hammer.
Combining a plate of §6Lead §rwith some wiring creates §6Lead Anodes and Cathodes§r. If they are combined with §6Sulfuric Acid§r, they can make a Lead Acid Battery.

A §6Vacuum Tube §o§ris a device that controls electric current flow in a high vacuum between electrodes. It's basically one of the components for the §6Primitive Circuit.§r

Combine all the items to make a Vacuum Tube.

Macerating is still an ore doubler like in other mods, but there is a twist, it does not give dusts directly! Crushed Ores are meant for more advanced ore processing. One Crushed Ore will convert to one dust.

To get the Impure Dust§r, hammer the Crushed Ore. 

This is done either by using a Hammer tool in the crafting table, or using the Steam Forge Hammer.

The Impure Dust can be smelted in the Furnace to get the Ingot, however mixed ores (Limonite, Chalcopyrite) will only give nuggets over ingots.

The Impure Dust can also be thrown in a vanilla Cauldron filled with water to clean it and turn it into a regular dust. Throw them in full stacks to consume less water per single dust.

§lNote: Macerating, hammering, and then smelting (sometimes into nuggets) is really time consuming in the steam age! Resource efficiency can be ignored for now. Nobody will blame you for smelting ores directly into ingots.

§2High pressure §rsteam machines require steel and they're two times faster than normal steam machines. High pressure §r§eboilers§r also generate steam twice as fast. Contrary to their name, they do not require actual High Pressure.
Lava can also be used to boil steam.

§6Solar boilers §rcan be used to get steam using the power of the sun. 
They only generate steam while the sun is up, 13 hours per day.
§6Bronze Drums §rdon't occupy much space, but they can store up to 32,000 L of fluid in a single block.
The §7LV Wiremill §ris a machine that processes §61 Ingot §rinto §62 Wires§r automatically. It can also process a Wire into §64 Fine Wires§r. It is §cmuch more efficient §rthan making wires manually.
In the Industrial Age you are able to produce better weapons. The §aHandcannon §ris one of those. It uses stone bullets as ammunition.

The §aDouble Barrel Shotgun§r is the first ever gun that you can make. It uses §aShotgun Rounds §o§rfor ammo.

It's a shotgun, this means it will fire 8 projectiles at once. For more info, look at the tooltip.
The §Trevolver uses §6Pistol Rounds §rfor ammo.

A §6Resistor§r is an electrical component that limits the flow of electrical current in an electronic circuit.

Resistors are another major component of §bLV circuits§r. They are made with sticky resin, which can be found on §2rubber trees§.. Use a §6Treetap §rto extract the resin.

§6Coated circuit boards§r are another component of LV circuits. They are made with sticky resin, and wood planks. A circuit board is used in electronic engineering to connect electronic components to one another.

You have to coat the board with wires to make it usable, turning it into a §6Basic Circuit Board§r.

Assembling the circuit parts (§6resistors§r, §bvacuum tubes§r, §cwiring§r, and the §2board§r) gets you one Primitive Circuit. 

Circuits are the brain of all electric machines - they're needed for the machine to work. There are over 10 different types of circuits - ranging from Primitive to extremely powerful bio-processors.

-- §aIMPORTANT INFORMATION§r --
- Surface gravity: 1g
- Day length: 24 hours 
- Atmosphere: Breathable (1 atm)
    1. 78.084% Nitrogen
    2. 20.946% Oxygen
    3. 0.9340% Argon
    4. 0.0417% Carbon Dioxide
    5. 0.001818% Neon
    6. 0.000524% Helium
    7. 0.000187% Methane
    8. 0.000114% Krypton
- Orbital period: 360 Days 
- Satellites:
    1. Moon
-------------------------

§aEarth§r is a terrestrial planet that orbits a star called §6the Sun§r. It has a rocky surface that is divided into various landforms known as continents. It includes vast oceans, towering mountains, lush forests, arid deserts, and polar ice caps. The oceans cover approximately 70% of the planet's surface, while the remaining 30% is made up of land.

The mountains on Earth can reach incredible heights. Forests on Earth are abundant and provide a home for many different species of plants and animals. These forests are a vital component of the planet's ecosystem and play an essential role in regulating the Earth's climate. 

§cBy digging down from the Earth's surface, one can encounter three types of rocks: Sedimentary, Igneous and Metamorphic. Sedimentary rocks, like limestone, can be found at altitude levels up to 40, while igneous rocks, like gabbro or granite, can be found between 0 and 40.

Under the Earth there is a cave system called The Beneath. This cave system is a complex network of underground tunnels, chambers, and passageways that stretches over a significant distance. You can get to it by digging down to Y level 0.

-- §aIMPORTANT INFORMATION§r --

Planet: §aEarth§r
ID: §a10§r
Depth: §c64m§r
-------------------------
§4Dig 64 meters from sea level to access the second layer. Please be aware while traversing The Beneath, as it is very dangerous.

§rThe Beneath refers to the deep, subterranean layers of the Earth's crust. These layers are composed of metamorphic rock. 

The rocks found in The Beneath are formed from the intense pressure and heat that are present deep within the Earth's crust. Within The Beneath, you can find ores that have been hidden for millions of years. For example: §6anthracite§r, a rare type of coal.

Exploring The Beneath requires specialized equipment and expertise. Several §b§kWeeping Angels §r can also be found in the Beneath. They are extremely dangerous entities, so be extremely careful while exploring.

-- §aIMPORTANT INFORMATION§r --

Planet: §aEarth§r
ID: §a-1§r
Depth: §c320m§r
-------------------------
§4Dig down to the bottom of the Beneath to access this dimension.§r

§3§4§lWARNING: Water buckets do not work at high temperatures. Tanks may be used to transport fluid here instead.

-- §aIMPORTANT INFORMATION§r --

- Surface gravity: 0.166g

- Day length: 30 Earth days

- Atmosphere: None

- Orbital period: 30 Earth days

- Orbits: Earth

- Satellites: None

-------------------------

§3WARNING: Due to technical restrictions, your internal clock will not work while on the Moon.

The §6lead–acid battery§r is the first type of rechargeable battery ever created. Compared to more powerful batteries, lead–acid batteries have relatively low energy density. But it's a start.

Combining Cathodes and Anodes makes a Battery.

§6Antimony §ris a semi-metal. In its metallic form it is silvery, hard and brittle. Antimony is used to make §6battery alloy§r, which is used to make the casings for §6batteries§r.

Antimony is found in §6Stibnite Ore§r, in the same deposit as §6Redstone §rand §6Cinnabar§r.
§6§rCombine §6Lead §rand §5§6Antimony §rdusts in a Steam Mixer to create Battery Alloy.

§6Quicklime§r, or calcium oxide, can be obtained by smelting limestone in a Furnace. Limestone can be found by mining underground. 

§6§rAt your current level of technology, §6Quicklime §rcan be turned into §6Slaked Lime §rusing either a §6Ceramic Bucket§r or a §6Bronze Drum§r. Since iron buckets aren't available now, and Bronze Drums are expensive, you can check the §6§lBalanced Bucket§r quest entry for more info. It will be used for the construction of §6firebricks§r.
§6Pistons §rare required to build most of your Steam machines, so it's important that you get a few of them.

§cThese should be your priorities for the first few days:

§r- Get gravel
- Get sticky resin
- Get an axe
- Chop a ton of wood
- Make a shelter over a Copper or Tin vein
- Get seeds from grass 
- Set up an indoor crop farm

There should also be some food rations which came in the drop pod. These should be enough to last a few days.

Combining a bunch of §6wires §rand a §6steel ring §rcreates the components for a §6Vacuum Tube§r. These will be put into a glass tube and sealed shut at an extremely low pressure using a §6Vacuum Chamber§r. For now, just make the components.

A §6vacuum chamber§r is a rigid enclosure from which air and other gases are removed by a vacuum pump.

This results in extremely low pressures, for example, the Vacuum Tube requires less than 130 §6§lmicro§l§r§6Pascals §rto function.

This is required to make the Vacuum Tube.

§6Wires §rcan be cut from a plate of metal using a §6Wire Cutter§r.

Energy consists of §6Voltage§r and §6Amperage§r. Think of amps as being energy packets that are sent from the generator.
A Low Voltage generator will output §632 EU/t§r (that's the voltage) in §61 amp§r.
If you have four generators they will output §632 volts in 4 amps§r together. 
32 volts in 4 amps is not the same thing as MV (Medium Voltage - 128 volts per amp)
This can be compared to four cables containing 32 volts each or one 4x Cable.

===============================

Let's talk about §4explosions§r.
There are multiple ways GT Electric machines can explode. 

§9Rain§r will make your electric machines explode if the rain hits the machine, so put your machinery under a proper roof§r. Wires without insulation will catch fire when they touch rain.
§c§r§4Fire§r will explode your machines if it gets too close.

§6If you give your machines too high voltage they will explode.§r 
To avoid making this error, I suggest that you make some space between different tiers of machines. 

You should also use different cables for different tiers to avoid mistakes. 
This means §ldo NOT use MV cables for LV energy§r§r, but it will be a while before we can get to that.

Combining §6Slaked Lime§r, §7Flint Dust§r, §6Sand Dust§r and §7Clay Balls (dusts can be made using a Mortar) will create §6Fireclay Mix§r.

Fireclay Mix can be turned into Compressed Fireclay by using a brick form.

§6Compressed Fireclay §rmust be smelted in a Furnace to turn it into §6Firebricks§r.

Firebricks need to be crafted into blocks to be used in the construction of a Blast Furnace. 32 Firebricks are required for a Primitive Blast Furnace.
The §6LV Polarizer §rmagnetizes substances without the use of a Voltaic Pile. For example, it can turn a normal Iron Rod into a Magnetic Iron Rod.

The §6Mixer §rcombines different fluids, and it also combines different dusts that can't be combined by hand. The §6Mixer§r is required in creating most alloys and in some chemical chains. It is also used to make §6concrete§r.

The §6Continuous Stirred Tank Reactor §ris a type of chemical reactor. There are several types of chemical reactors, and each one will be used for a different type of reaction.

The §6CSTR §rdoes continuous reactions between §6fluids §rand §6gases§r. Continuous processes involve two fluids or gases slowly reacting with each other. This is why it reacts only 10L of fluid every half a second or so instead of doing 1,000 L at once.

The §6Trickle Bed Reactor §ris a type of chemical reactor. 

The §6Trickle Bed Reactor §rdoes continuous reactions between §6fluids §rinvolving a §6catalyst§r that can only be in dust form. It does §6continuous §rprocesses, just like the CSTR.

The § §6Bubble Column Reactor §ris a type of chemical reactor. 

The §6Bubble Column Reactor §rdoes reactions that involve bubbling a §6gas §rinto another fluid. It does §6continuous §rprocesses, just like the CSTR.

The §6Fixed Bed Reactor §ris another type of chemical reactor.

It does reactions that involve §6a catalyst tray§r. Unlike the Trickle Bed Reactor, the catalyst has to be put in a tray instead of just using a dust. The FBR does continuous processes.
The §6Crystallizer §ris a machine that is required to crystallize large quantities of §bFluids §rinto solids.
§6Electrolysis§r is a stage in the separation of elements from naturally occurring sources, such as ores using an §6Electrolyzer§r.
The §6Gas Collector §rcollects §bair §rfrom the environment. Air can be used in §6sintering§r and it also can be separated into §bnitrogen §rand §boxygen §rusing §bcryogenic distillation.

Combining §6Mud Balls§r, a §6Pile of Sand§r, §6Clay Dust §rand §aStraw§r (obtained from Plant Fibers) will create §6Mudbrick Mix§
.

Mudbricks are §6not required §rfor progressing to the Industrial Age, however they can be used for constructing a §6Primitive Baking Oven§r.

Compressing §5§6Mudbrick Mix§r using a Brick Form creates Mud Bricks. Smelting them in a Furnace creates §6Adobe Bricks§r.

Adobe Bricks need to be combined into blocks to be used in construction.

The §6Electromagnetic Separator §ris a machine that uses the power of the magnetic field to §6sift ores §rand §6remove salt from oil§r.
Your §6sulfuric fractions §rhave to be §6treated §rby reacting the fluid with §9hydrogen§r in a Fixed Bed Reactor.

Putting Water and Salt Water in an Electrolytic Cell with a Nickel Rod and a Graphite Electrode as the anode and cathode will yield §3Chlorine§r, Hydrogen and §3Sodium Hydroxide§r solution. 

If the quest does not work, you can just click the §6checkbox§r.
§6Distilling §rthe Sodium Hydroxide solution will give §6Sodium Hydroxide §rdust.

You are about to start a long chemical process for obtaining §baluminium§r, a material needed for MV tier. This is the first page.
If you ever feel confused, take a look at the §6Chemistry §rtab.
It is recommended that you set this up to be an automatic process, with each machine feeding onto the next one. 

First of all, you will need to get §6bauxite§r. Bauxite is found in ore deposits from height level 0 to 80.

The Bauxite Ore must be §6smelted §rinto Bauxite Dust, which is then reacted with §6Sodium Hydroxide §rin an §6LV Roaster §rto get Impure Sodium Aluminate solution.

The solution is then §ccentrifuged§r with an LV centrifuge to remove the impurities and get Sodium Aluminate solution.
The §cCentrifuge §r§rcentrifuges impurities out of solids, and it is also used to get §arare materials§r out of ore dusts.

The §3Crafting Station§r is a highly advanced Crafting Table§r, with inventory slots for item and tools.

Put the recipes in the table either by dropping ghost items, or using the §a+§r in §2JEI§r. 

Crafting the items will use the items and tools in the inventory of the table. The 9 slots on the right are saved up recipes so you can re-use them without re-opening §2JEI§r.

The §3Crafting Station§r can use §6adjacent inventories§r in addition to its own inventory.

In order to get aluminium ingots, you need an §6electric blast furnace§r. Some recipes in the Electric Blast Furnace require §6120 EU/t§r, so you'll need two energy hatches. 

The Electric Blast Furnace is a multi structure. It is §63x4x3§r in size. 

When building your first EBF, you will need:

§61 Electric Blast Furnace
16 Cupronickel Coil Blocks
1 Input Bus (For inputting items and the control circuits)
1 Input Hatch (Any tier will work)
1 LV output bus (At least an LV one)
1 Maintenance Hatch 
2 LV Energy Hatches
9-12 Heat Proof Machine Casings§r

Your cupronickel coil blocks can only reach a temperature of §71700 K§r, so you will need higher tier coils to do more advanced recipes. 

If you are confused, check JEI for the machine structure.

§cThe Electric Blast Furnace and the Electrolytic Cell require a lot of power. You can't just run them on the same power grid! You should try investing in one (or even multiple) Large Turbines.

At MV tier, you will be able to use a Combined Cycle fuel setup for even more energy efficiency.
§6Crystallize §rthe Sodium Aluminate solution in aa §6Crystallizer §rwith water to get§5§6 Aluminium Hydroxide§r.
§6Aluminum Hydroxide §r§rcan be reduced to Alumina in an Electric Blast Furnace. Later on, Alumina can be reduced directly to Aluminium for a small price of 960 EU/t.
The §6Weapons Factory §rmakes guns, turrets, ammo, and other weapon-related items.

If you want to make turrets, you'll need turret bases. Let's make some.

They are a block that acts as the base for turrets. They use §cRF §renergy. You can put Turrets on all sides of the block, just note that every turret needs a minimum tier of base to be able to be placed. 

All the settings for a modular turret is being stored and set in the base that holds the turrets. In their interface, you should find most descriptions pretty easily.
Turret Chambers and Barrels will be required to make turret heads.

The Gun Turret shoots at whatever gets into a 18m radius of it. It needs a Tier 2 or higher turret base. 

It uses §4100 RF§r (25 EU) per shot, and it shoots 2.5 times per second.

It uses bullets as ammo.

The Incendiary Turret yeets fire at whatever gets into a 18m radius of it. It needs a Tier 2 or higher turret base. 

It uses §4250 RF§r (14.8 EU) per shot, and it shoots 0.8 times per second.

It uses flaming clay as ammo.

The §6Pistol §ris one of the guns you can make at LV tier. It uses pistol magazines as ammo, and has a reload time of 1.75 seconds.

For more info, look at the tooltip.

The §6Combat Shotgun §ris one of the guns you can make at LV tier. It uses shotgun magazines as ammo, and has a reload time of 2.5 seconds. It's also multishot, this means it will shoot 8 times at once. 

Crafting it requires a §6Steel Receiver§r.

For more info, look at the tooltip.

§6Alumina §rneeds to be roasted with §6Hydrofluoric Acid§r to make §bAluminium Trifluoride.§r

In an Electrolytic Cell, react §610 Alumina Dust§r, 1 §6Aluminium Trifluoride§r, 3 §6§6Carbon Dust§r and§6 Cryolite fluid §rto get §64 Aluminium Ingots§r.

You can extract the fluid out of Cryolite using an §cLV Extractor§r.
You can §ccentrifuge §6Carbon §rout of various carbonaceous sources, such as coal dust or coke dust.
The §cExtractor §rextracts §cfluid §rout of solid materials. For example, you can get §6liquid rubber§o§o§r by putting rubber in. It can also extract §aseed oil §rout of seeds.
Using an alternate version of the §6chloroalkali process§r, using a §crock salt §rsolution instead of normal salt water.§r

You can electrolyze §6§cIMPURE §rSodium Hydroxide Solution in an Electrolyzer to get §6Gallium§r, an important element required for circuits.

The §7§6Architect's Sawmill §fallows you to create many different set shapes from any cubic non-tile entity (the §acrafting table§f is the only known exception).  These include 45 degree angle slopes. 

Tile entities are blocks that are capable of additional operations like machines, or provide effects (like a note block).

The §6Architect's Hammer§r allows you to rotate blocks along the vertical axis by right clicking. §aShift right-clicking§r allows you to cycle through every possible rotation.

The §6Architect's Chisel§r has a few niche uses. One use is to connect or unconnect blocks together, such as fences. Another use is to harvest glass without breaking it by§b§a right-clicking§r.

§2Littletiles §fis an incredibly powerful mod that allows you to manipulate blocks by their 16x16x16 subcomponents, known as §bpixels§r.

The §6Little Bag §rtakes in blocks and converts them to a form with a finite pixel quantity for use with §2Littletiles§r. It also takes in any dyes, and converts them to a quantity in the bag corresponding with the §bC§dM§d§eY§8K§r subtractive color model. (§bCyan, §dMagenta, §eYellow,§r and §8Key (black))

§rThe §6Little Chisel, Little Hammer,§r §6Little Saw§r, and §6Little Glove§r can have their menus accessed by §a'C'§r by default, where you can set the draw shape, as well as setting a color, which will consume the color in the bag. §eYou may need to rebind this to something else, due to existing key conflicts in Supersymmetry. This bind is named "Configure Tool".§r You can see other options by looking at the text that shows up in the lower left corner when you hold the tool in your hand.  §e

§fThe §6Little Chisel§r can be used for additive changes to §bpixels§r, and is used by §aright-clicking§r. 

The §6Little Hammer§r can be used for subtractive changes to §bpixels§r, and is used by §aleft-clicking§r. 

The §6Little Saw§r can be used for extrusive changes to §bfaces§r, and is used by §aright-clicking and shift right-clicking§r (The lower left corner is §4§c§lLYING§r to you)!

The §6Little Glove§r has multiple modes
- Placing rectangles of pixels of defined dimensions
- Copying placed structures to the hand (Recipe Mode)
- Replacing pixels on the face you are looking at with other pixels
All of which are accessible by §aright-clicking§r.

§6Little Blueprints§r can be used by §aleft-clicking§r and §aright-clicking§r the boundaries of your creations, similar to Worldedit, hitting the binded menu key (§a'C'§r by default), and saving it after changing a few parameters if you wish. You can §aright-click§r with this blueprint later to "paste" this creation somewhere else, given enough resources. Effectively, Blueprints are a ctrl + c, ctrl + v tool.

The aforementioned parameters in the menu can be used to paste your creation with different behaviors, such as it becoming a §b§ddoor, storage, a ladder, or other various things.§r This is part of the reason why §2Littletiles§r is considered to be incredibly powerful.

You can use a §6Little Workbench§r to craft your copied structure and produce it as an inventory item.

§8§mSpamming Among Us everywhere has never been this easy!

These are some of the §2Littletiles§r tools which you will be using less commonly. 

The §6Little Paint Brush§r is used for using the aformentioned paint in your §6Little Bag§r to paint your structures. Like other tools, you can access the menu to change the shape, as well as color.
§6§r
The §6Little Wrench§r is used for updating §2Littletiles§r blocks experiencing graphical issues, such as unconnected corners/edges, or unrendered sides.

The§6 Little Screwdriver§r §eis a creative exclusive item, and will not be included as a task§r, but it allows you to replace§b pixels§r with other §bpixels§r from other blocks given a draw shape from the menu.

§2Chisel§r is well known for being the miraculous tool that can turn entire warehouses full of worthless cobble into decent looking building material. Every vanilla block, a few common metal blocks, and the blocks added by this specific mod can all be chiseled. §eSamples are shown in the following quests. §r

The §6iChisel§r has 2 more area options than the Steel Chisel, more versatile inventory chiseling, and the ability to preview the selected chisel pattern in different patterns. 

For now, making a normal §6Chisel§r shall suffice.

Antiblocks are brightly colored blocks which completely ignore any lighting effects they are exposed to. §e§rThey can be seen from kilometers away in pitch black darkness as a result. §eKeep in mind that they do not actually emit light themselves.§r

§r§d§r§5Voidstones§r are "mystical" and "eldritch" blocks that come in incomprehensible glyphs or glimpses into the ever-shifting tides of the unknown. If you are into magic, you probably think they're nice.

§9Futura Blocks§r, despite the small set of available textures in the block set, are probably many people's favorite. They depict flashy screens, rainbows, and even fake ME controllers. They supplement the §4§r§cG§6r§ce§6g§ci§6c §raesthetic well.

Cement is one of the key components for making §6concrete§r.

It must then be cooled in a Mixer with air, and pulverized to make cement dust. 

Concrete is critical for the §4§r§cG§6r§ce§6g§ci§6c §raesthetic.

Machines like the §6Pyrolyse Oven §rand §5§6Electric Blast Furnace §rrequire coils to work. Coils require §6mineral wool sheets §rfor insulation, which are obtained by centrifuging §d§clava§r.

§6Building Wands §rare wands that build surfaces for you. There are 4 main types of wands:

The §7Stone Building Wand§r can only place 5 blocks at a time, can only place blocks vertically, and can place ~130 blocks before it breaks.

The Iron Building Wand can place 9 blocks at a time, can place vertically or horizontally, and can place ~250 blocks.

The §bDiamond Building Wand §rcan place as many blocks that it can, which is ~1562 blocks before it breaks.

The §dUnbreakable Building Wand §rcan place an inventory's worth of blocks at a time, and never breaks.

You can change the mode of the Building Wand by pressing §6M§..
§6Gunpowder §rcan be obtained by mixing §6saltpeter §r(found in salt deposits in deserts), §6sulfur §rand§7§6 coal.

Sometimes building large structures can be a little tedious, and take a lot of effort. §6Building Gadgets §raims to make building a little bit easier.

The §6Building Gadget §rallows you to build structures using a set of different Building Modes. It allows you to build structures at range. Simply§a right click§r to place the blocks, and §asneak-right click§r to set the block type to place.

The §6Exchanging Gadget §rwill swap the block you are looking at with the block the tool is set to. Simply §aright click§r to swap the blocks, and §asneak-right click §rto set the block type to place.

The §6Copy Paste Gadget §rwill allow you to copy an area of a large area of blocks and paste it in a different location. You can view the required materials on the tooltip.

The §cDestruction Gadget§r allows you to void large areas. The Gadget will void the blocks instead of dropping them. There is a single §cUndo§r if you accidentally use the tool, which can be activated via the GUI.

§6§rIron §6stairs §rand §7§6catwalks §rcan be used to supplement the §4§r§cG§6r§ce§6g§ci§6c§r aesthetic. §rThe factory must grow.

An §6arc furnace§r (EAF) is a furnace that heats material by means of an electric arc. An arc furnace requires §boxygen §rto work, so make sure to check out water electrolysis. The Arc Furnace can be used for decomposing machines into their constituent metals.

A §6diode §ris an electronic component that conducts current primarily in one direction. They are required for constructing §7§6Medium Voltage circuits§r.

You can make a diode by combining fine copper wires with §6§6galena §rand §6molten glass§r in an Assembler. Melt the glass using an Extractor. There is a more efficient way to make diodes later on but it requires polyethylene.
Centrifuge §6Sticky Resin§r to obtain liquid§6 Resin§r, then distill the Resin to get §6Glue§r.

Combine §6Glue §rand wood pulp in an Assembler to make a phenolic circuit board. Then coat it with §7silver §rwires to finalize the circuit board.

Circuits are defined by two characteristics: their §6technological level§r (electronic, quantum, optical, etc,) and their "rank" in a given §6technology tier§r (assembly, mainframe, etc.)

These two characteristics give a circuit its name and voltage tier (e.g. the Micro Computer, an EV circuit and the 3rd micro circuit.)

The first technological tier of circuits, primitive circuits, is crafted by hand. The following tiers are fabricated in Circuit Assemblers, or the Assembly Line for high-end assemblies, computers and mainframes. 

Higher technological tiers demand more complex processing chains for their respective components, but generally follow similar patterns in terms of what components they require (SMDs, circuit boards, metal frames for mainframes, etc.) 

Technological advancement will also allow you to make previous circuits more efficiently (e.g. using SoCs to craft Refined Processors without through-hole/SMD components.)

A §6catalyst§r is a substance that speeds up a chemical reaction without being consumed in the process.

There are §6catalyst beds, pellets, and dusts§r, depending on the machine used. §cTiered§r catalysts can affect speed and energy consumption, similarly to the way overclocking can increase the efficiency of a machine.

The§6 Large Steam Turbine §rcan generate power using§6 steam§r. It is a larger version of the small LV steam turbine.

It generates §616 amps §rof LV power and turns 960 L of steam into 960 L of exhaust steam every 0.5 seconds.

A §6radiator§o§o§r is a device that transfers heat from a fluid or object to the surrounding environment.

§6Incendiary explosives§r start fires upon detonation. They use flammable substances like §cgasoline or naphtha §ras their fuel sources. When ignited, these volatile liquids rapidly vaporize and create a combustible mixture with the air, causing fires to spread quickl§yy.§6

Chemical explosives§r rely on specific compounds like §ccarbon monoxide, hydrogen sulfide, fluorine, or chlorine gas§r. These highly reactive substances undergo fast oxidation or combustion reactions, releasing large volumes of gas and heat.

§6Debilitation explosives§r have a different objective — they aim to incapacitate rather than cause destruction. They often contain §csulfur dioxide§r, a toxic gas that causes respiratory distress and eye irritation. Debilitation explosives are used for temporary incapacitation or crowd control.

§6Shrapnel explosives§r are a type of explosive device that incorporates lead rounds as shrapnel. These devices are designed to cause damage and injury through the release of high-velocity projectiles upon detonation.

Most of these chemicals are obtainable in LV. Check the Chemistry tab for more info.

A §6grenade §rcan be useful if you have to clear out hordes of enemies at the same time.

Since Medium Voltage machinery requires 4 times the energy of LV machines, it is recommended that you make a new power setup. 
You can probably just slap a new MV dynamo hatch on that Turbine, but it would be very inefficient.

The §6Combined Cycle §rprocess requires that you make a§a Heat Exchanger§r to turn a working fluid (Water) into its§5 Hot High Pressure §rvariant (Steam). §cFlue gas§f from burning fuels in the §aGas Turbine§f is used to provide the heating.

After putting the steam into a Turbine, it will release §epower§r and a§c hot normal pressure fluid§r, which can be cooled back into water to start the process all over again.

If you're confused, here's a flowchart: https://media.discordapp.net/attachments/1029723495577419859/1110649444388581406/gtthermo.png?width=1170&height=676
Mix §6Water §rwith Flour to make a Grain Solution.

§6Ethanol §ris a versatile, flammable alcohol produced through fermentation, commonly used as a fuel and solvent. It is also used to produce§6 polyethylene§r.

§6Impure Ethanol §r§rcan be manufactured in a Fermentation Vat with sugar, grain solution and water. The impurities can then be filtered out using a §cdistillery§r.

This only creates an azeotrope of ethanol and water though, which is still pure enough for creating §6ethylene.§f Further purification requires toluene and more distillation.
§bEthylene §rcan be obtained by reacting §6Sulfuric Acid§f with §6Ethanol§f OR §6Ethanol-Water Azeotrope§f (which is about 90% pure) in a §cCSTR§r.
§6Polyethylene §ris the first type of plastic polymer you can make, being possible as early as MV. Ethylene needs to be §bpolymerized §rwith oxygen to produce PE.

§6Silicon Dioxide §rcan be centrifuged from sand or flint.

When silicon dioxide is §croasted§r with coke it undergoes a chemical reaction to produce§6 silicon carbide§r. 

Silicon carbide can then be §carc furnaced§r to obtain§6 silicon.

Now that you are in §6Medium Voltage§r, you should create a new MV machinery line, which is separate from your LV machinery. 

Accidentally inputting MV voltage into an LV machine can make it §cexplode§r.

Since you already know most of the machines, we are going to skip introducing them with a new quest. To complete this quest, make an MV Assembler.

§6Silicon §rreacts with §3chlorine §rto produce §6silicon tetrachloride §rin a roaster.

The resulting SiCl4 undergoes §cpurification in a distillery§r, yielding purified SiCl4.

High purity silicon is obtained by reacting Zinc dusts with the purified SiCl4 in a§c roaster§r.

§6High Purity Silicon §rcan be turned into a Seed Crystal in an §cLV Autoclave§r.

The crystal must be combined with a further amount of liquid §6high purity silicon§r in an §cMV Crystallizer §rfor a long amount of time (07:30), so remember to have a stable power setup near your silicon processing line.
§bDistilled Water §rcan be obtained by §cdistilling §rWater.

A §6Cutting Saw §rcan use Water or Lubricant to cut items. It's required for making silicon wafers out of boules.

Now that you are at MV, you can make more advanced types of §cexplosives §rand §cmissiles §rby putting MV power on a Weapons Factory.

It is used in assembling §6grenades§r.

§9Lapis Lazuli§r is a deep-blue metamorphic rock. It is considered to be a semi-precious stone due to its vibrant color. You will need this to craft the §6Crowbar§r, and the various tools required for §2Littletiles§r.

Machine Covers are critical for you to achieve more advanced automation. They are attachments that can be physically placed on the side of machines, or with pipes. They are important for finely-tuned control over the input or output of items and fluids.

You can interact with all covers by §ashift-right clicking§r on the face the cover is sitting on. Or, if you have a §6Screwdriver§r, you can simply right click the face directly and can even access the cover from a neighboring face. You can remove covers using a §6Crowbar§r.

§6Pumps, Robot Arms,§r and §6Conveyors§r are all machine components that can be used as covers. For information on their operation, you may refer to their quests.

The simplest way to explain §6Fluid Regulators§r is that they are §6Robot Arms§r, but for fluids. They can monitor the state of the current inventory, as well as the neighboring inventory, and act on this information, as well as supplying in specific batches.

§6Filters§r, when used as §6Covers§r, passively impose restrictions on the items or fluids that may pass in-between them through manual outputs. However, some of their more powerful uses is in-conjunction with other covers, which have a dedicated slot for a filter. All filters may be toggled to only function with input, output, or both at once.

Both §6Item filters§r and §6Fluid filters§r are self-explanatory. When combined with a robot arm/fluid regulator, you may use the fluid interface to determine the batch size that the robot arm will consider.

An §6Ore Dictionary filter§r will filter items based on their ore dictionary entries (an ore-dictionary entry set to §6plankWood§r will be able to accept all wood planks, etc.). You can even supply Regex expressions for a substantially expanded field of options. For example, you can supply §cingotHot*§r for the filter to act on all hot ingots§r. You can see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Regular_expression for more information.

A §6Smart Filter§r can be automatically set to consider the recipes of either an electrolyzer, sifter, or centrifuge, and will filter items based on the quantities present in the recipe.

The §6Crowbar§r is a neat tool used mainly for removing §6Covers§r without the need to destroy the block it has been placed on. Covers are critical for the more advanced automation you will need in Gregtech.

This is also used for important recipes such as the §6Maintenance Hatch§r, as well as being involved in the maintenance process.

To make §6glass§r, you will need to macerate sand (either via machine or mortar) to get §6quartz dust§r, combine this with §6tiny flint dust§r to get §6glass dust§r, and then put this into an §6Alloy Smelter§r with a §6block mold§r to get glass blocks.
Assemble 5 pieces of §bflour§r, a §3water bucket§r, and a tiny pile of §5salt §rto get yourself some bread dough.

The §6Cheese Pizza§r should be the easiest for you to produce due to the lack of different ingredients required.

The possible pizzas you can make are:

§eCheese Pizza§r - using mozzarella cheese and flattened dough. Requires tomato sauce, which can be produced by tomato slices in an extractor.
§aOlive and Mushroom Pizza§r - mozzarella, dough, tomato sauce, along with sliced olives and mushrooms.
§cMinced Meat Pizza§r - mozzarella, dough, tomato sauce, and minced meat, obtained by macerating meat product.

All pizzas require a §4§lHV §6Cuisine Assembler§r to create.

What kind of civilization can exist in the absence of §cnourishment§r? What culture does a civilization have if it does not have great §ccuisine§r?

Outside of the obvious benefits of satiating hunger, there are plenty of physical benefits you can exploit through well-prepared meals. The majority of foods created using the §6Cuisine Assembler§r will give you a variety of §9effects§r that will enhance your ability to survive and thrive in this world. There are also a few other consumables which may give you effects without the use of a §6Cuisine Assembler§r, although they typically require a §6Cannery§r.

§6Cream§r can be produced by centrifuging §6Pasteurized milk§r.

§6Pasteurized milk§r can be produced by simply running regular §6milk§r through a fluid heater.

Keep in mind that milk can be automatically harvested using a §6Mob Extractor§r.

A colloid is any mixture which has suspended insoluble solids within it. §6Milk§r is already a colloid due to having microscopic fat globules already present, but mixing in §6Soy Lecithin§r makes it colloid-er.

Mix ordinary §6Milk§r, §6Soy Lecithin§r, and §6Sugar§r to produce §6Milk Colloid§r.

§6Lecithins§r are a group of yellowish fatty substances from plants and animals. You can acquire §6Soy Lecithin§r by centrifuging §6Hydrated Soybean Oil§r. 

§6Hydrated Soybean Oil§r may be acquired by mixing water with §6Raw Soybean Oil§r. 

§6Raw Soybean Oil§r is extracted from §6Soybean Seeds§r.

§6Soybeans§r may be produced from §6Undetermined Seeds§r.

Remember that you can extract small amounts of fluid into your inventory by using a large fluid cell (made from steel, aluminum, etc.)

§6Fertilizers§r work by supplying 3 key nutritional elements to plants:
- §ePhosphorus§r
- §bNitrogen§r
-§a Potassium

§rBy using JEI, you can see countless numbers of recipes for fertilizers. The fundamental logic behind each recipe is that there must be one compound supplying one of these key nutrients. For example, §7ash§r is a source of §apotassium§r, while §2bio-chaff§r & §2fertilized biomass§r is a source of both §apotassium§r and §bnitrogen§r.

Mechanically, fertilizer may be used as a more easily mass-produceable version of bonemeal, however it is required in order to operate the §6Greenhouse§r.

One part §6Milk Colloid§r mixed with one part §6Cream§r produces two parts of §6Ice Cream Mixture§r. 

This can then be solidified using a §6Fluid Solidifier§r and a ball mold to create §6Plain Ice Cream§r.

Mixing four parts of §6Plain Ice Cream§r with one part §6Vanillin§r produces four parts of §6Vanilla Ice Cream§r. 

I hope you enjoyed your introductory course in lengthy §2GTFO§r food chains, because there are more complex recipes implemented.

This page will describe the process on how to make§b liquid oxygen§r, but it's the same for most gases.

§9Oxygen §rcan be compressed to make §cHot High-Pressure oxygen §rusing a fluid compressor. This only takes 30 EU/t for oxygen, but it's 200 EU/t or higher for most fluids.

Advancements in agricultural technology was one of the most pivotal innovations in history. Using the §6Greenhouse§r, you can mass produce any crop or tree.

By using §6Weed Killer§r and/or §6Pesticide§r, you can improve the yield even further.

Unless you have a target consumer audience to appeal to, treating crops with Pesticides and Herbicides will greatly improve the quantity of the crop created by your §6Greenhouse§r.

Both §6Weed Killer§r and §6Pesticide§r contain §6Water§r and §6Sodium Stearate§r.
Outside of these, all you need is:
§2Weed Killer§r - §6Acetic Acid§r & §6Salt§r
§ePesticide§r - §6Seed Oil§r

Liquid Fat (§6Stearin§r) can be extracted from §6Animal Fat§r.
Stearin needs to be mixed with Sodium Hydroxide and Water to make §bSoap (Sodium Stearate)§r.

§bAcetic Acid §r§rcan be obtained by pyrolyzing Wood and distilling the Wood Vinegar.

The §cHot High Pressure Oxygen §rmust be then cooled down to make§a High Pressure Oxygen. 

§fThis can either be done with a §cRadiator §ror with a §cHeat Exchanger, but the Heat Exchanger requires water to work.

The§a High Pressure Oxygen §r§r§ris then cooled to make §bCold High Pressure Oxygen. §f
This step can only be done in the Heat Exchanger and it requires a §brefrigerant §rto cool it down to -50°C.

A refrigerant can either be §bCold Ammonia, Carbon Monoxide or Cold Propane§r.

§bCold Carbon Dioxide §rcan be made by first compressing Carbon Dioxide into Hot Compressed CO2, then radiating out the heat using a Radiator, and then decompressing it to make §bCold CO2§r.

There are 7 types of ore deposits: §6Orthomagmatic, Metamorphic, Sedimentary, Magmatic Hydrothermal, Hydrothermal, Residual and Alluvial§r.

The Ore Sorter offers §64 recipes for each power tier§r.
For instance, using the HV recipe in the Ore Sorter results in a greater variety of ores being generated compared to the LV recipe.

Orthomagmatic deposits are found in mountains.
Placer and Alluvial deposits are found in beaches, deserts and rivers.
Magmatic Hydrothermal deposits are found in mountains.
Hydrothermal deposits are found in areas near water.
Sedimentary deposits are found in swamps, bogs, and mesa biomes.
Metamorphic deposits are found close to mountains, but sometimes in plains and forest biomes too.
The §aSifting Machine §rsifts gems§r into their various different types, and it sifts §cevaporite deposits§r. More on that in the next page.

§6Evaporite deposits §rcan be found in §6deserts, §brivers, §rand §cmesas§r, and they have to be §6Pulverized and Sifted §rto process them into new ore dusts.

They can be a good source of §bsalt§r. There are 4 types of deposits: §6Carbonate, Sulfate, Halide, and Non-Marine§r.

Extra information:

An §6evaporite deposit§r refers to a type of sedimentary rock formation that originates from the §6precipitation and subsequent evaporation of saline water§r. These deposits are composed of minerals that are left behind when the water evaporates, §6leaving behind concentrated mineral salts§r.

The §6Boat §ris the simplest form of transportation on water, as it requires only a few pieces of Wood.

This quest requires an oak boat. If you can't find oak, just click on the §2checkbox§r.
§6Wood Vinegar §rcan be obtained by §cpyrolyzing Wood§r. Wood Vinegar can be then §cdistilled §rto produce §a§6Acetic Acid§r.

§cCarts§r require §6Rails §rand §6Powered Rails §rto work. Powered Rails use redstone power to speed up the movement of the cart.

§6Detector Rails §o§rproduce a redstone signal when a minecart is on it.

§6Transfer Rails §rcan transfer a Cargo Cart to another line.

These carts are not as fast as big §ctrains§r, which can reach speeds of 100km/h.

There are several types of carts.

§6Passenger Carts §rcan transport a passenger.
§6Log Carts §rcan only transport wood.
§6Cargo Carts §rcan transport the same amount of inventory space as a chest.
§6Fluid Tank Carts §rcan transport fluids.
§6Silver Oxide §rmust then be roasted with Carbon to make §6Silver§r.
§6Acanthite §rcan be §croasted §rwith Oxygen to create §6Silver Oxide§r.
A §6Rail Gate §rcan be used to block certain carts from passing.

Welcome to the §aPeriodic Table§r. This chapter will list all 118 elements and how to obtain them in several different ways.

Each element has 3 ways to obtain:

§lPrimitive:§r the first way in which an element is produced, not very efficient and limited byproducts.

§lUniversal:§r a more modern way to produce a thing, more efficient and can produce byproducts.

§lSpecialized:§r either for producing §6very high purities §ror further increasing production efficiency and byproducts, typically unlocked later on.

With access to circuits and decent materials, you can explore §9OpenComputers§f and its addons.

If you have the know-how to use those mods, they can be §aextremely powerful tools§f to support your ever expanding base.

Scroll down to the §b"Programming"§f section in the questbook to learn more about OpenComputers.

To turn §6Wafers §rinto §6Doped Wafers§r, Ion Implantation is required.

Each Wafer needs both§6 an N and P dopant§r to be doped. 
N dopants are: §cHigh-Purity§r Arsenic, Antimony, Phosphorus
P dopants are:§c High-Purity §rAluminium, Gallium, Boron and Indium

Since there are so many possible ways to make a doped wafer, I suggest going to the §cPeriodic Table §rand looking at the Specialized section of each element to figure out how to make its high-purity version. I suggest using Arsenic as an N dopant and either Gallium or Boron as a P dopant.

A§6 UV light box §ris used in photolithography to §aexpose and pattern photoresist §ron a substrate using ultraviolet light.

You can §6etch §ra pattern on the wafer by using photoresist and a photolithography mask.

For now, etch an §5IC and a RAM pattern §ron the wafer. You will need more of them later.

A §7photoresist §rs a light-sensitive material used in photoengraving, to form a patterned coating on a surface. This process is crucial in the electronics industry.

§6Novolacs Photoresist §o§ris made by mixing phenol and formaldehyde.
§6Creosote §rcan be distilled from Coal Tar. §6Creosote §rcan also be distilled into §cPhenol§r.
§6Wood Vinegar §rcan be distilled to §6Methanol§r, which has to be reacted with Oxygen under a §7Silver catalyst bed §o§rto make Formaldehyde.
Pattern Wafers can be §6etched§o§r with Hydrofluoric Acid or Nitric Acid. I suggest using the first.
Etched wafers need to be§6 electrolyzed with a copper foil and sulfuric acid §rto create a fully-functioning §cWafer§r.
§6Wafers §rneed to be cut in an MV Cutting Saw using Ultrapure Water to make §6Plates§r. §rFor now, make an IC and a RAM plate, as we'll need it later.

100 mB§b Demineralized Water §rcan be distilled into§b 5 mB of Ultrapure Water§r. 

Since this is a very inefficient process, there are §cseveral things you can do to increase the yield§r:

- Eject the Demineralized Water in a §cVacuum Chamber §rwith §7Steam and turn it into §bDeareated Water§r, then distill it for §l15 mB§r of Ultra Pure Water

- Filter the Deareated Water with §aCellulose Acetate Mesh§r in a §cCompressor§r, turning it into §3Filtered Water§r, then distill it for§l 30 mB §rof Ultra Pure Water. §c§lThis step requires High Voltage and a 9 step chain.§r

- Sterilize the Filtered Water in an§c UV Light Box§r, making §3Sterilized Water§r, then distill it for the highest yield of §l90 mB §rof Ultra Pure Water

§c§lThese last three steps are optional. For more info, look at the Chemistry tab.
§6Silicon Dioxide §rcan be reacted with Steam and §9Sodium Hydroxide Solution §rto create Sodium Silicate.

Aluminium can be reacted with the Sodium Hydroxide solution to form §9Sodium Aluminate§r.

Then, Sodium Aluminate and Sodium Silicate can be combined to create §aRaw Molecular Sieve§r.

The §bRaw Molecular Sieve needs to be autoclaved §rto finish processing.

An §6Ion Exchange Column§r is a cylindrical structure that selectively §6remove or exchange ions from a solution§r passing through it.

In an ion exchange column, §bWater §rpasses through beads that attract and exchange mineral ions, resulting in §bdemineralized water§r. This is needed for making ultra-pure water.

Gallium can be§c reacted§r with Chlorine to form §6Crude Gallium Trichloride§r.
Crude Gallium Trichloride needs to be §cdistilled§r into §6Gallium Trichloride§r.
Gallium Trichloride can be §creacted §rwith Hydrogen to form §6High Purity Gallium§r.

Or, if you don't want to do the whole process, you can use a §aVacuum Distillation Tower§r.

§6Arsenic Trioxide §rcan be§c roasted§r with Hydrogen Chloride resulting in the formation of§6 Crude Arsenic Trichloride §rand Water. 

The §6Crude Arsenic Trichloride§r can then be §cdistilled§r to obtain Arsenic Trichloride. 

Lastly, when 3,000 liters of Hydrogen §creact§r with 1,000 liters of Arsenic Trichloride, it yields §6High Purity Arsenic§r and 3,000 liters of Hydrogen Chloride.

Trains created by the Railroad Engineering Station are too large to function on Minecraft's vanilla Rails. Which is why you'll need Immersive Railroading's Tracks.

Tracks can be placed by right clicking a Track Blueprint on the ground while having some Wooden Planks of any type and Rail Segments in your inventory. Doing so will create a track about 10 meters in length, which will consume several Planks and Segments from your inventory, so make sure you carry quite a few stacks of those with you when you're laying track.

Right clicking a Track Blueprint while not looking at any block will open a menu allowing you to customize your Tracks. You can change things like the curvature of the track, the look of the track, and so on.

§6Vacuum distillation §ris a process that involves distilling substances under §6reduced pressure§r, typically below atmospheric pressure. 

By lowering the pressure in the distillation system, the boiling points of the components being distilled are reduced. 

This allows for the§6 separation of substances that have high boiling points or are thermally sensitive§r, like gallium or chlorine.

§6The Vacuum Distillation Tower requires:
- 1 Vacuum Distillation Tower
- 1 Energy Hatch (I suggest MV)
- 1 Output Hatch
- 1 Maintenance Hatch
- 1 Input Hatch
- 15 Steel Frame Box
- 79 Solid Steel Machine Casing
- 1 Steel Pipe Casing

Any of the §63 MV batteries§r can be used to store MV energy.

A §6transistor§r is a miniature semiconductor that regulates or controls current. They are used in §cHV circuits§r.

§cAdvanced Integrated Circuits §rare the first type of §cHV§r circuits you can make. §rThey're made from §6MV circuits§r, §7IC and RAM chips§r, §atransistors§r, §b§6and electrum foils§r.

Since this is a very complicated process, requiring a lot of LV circuits for a single HV circuits, you can use the §cMV Circuit Assembler §rto make microprocessors, a better way of making MV and HV circuits.

Polyvinyl Chloride (§6PVC§r) is a high-strength thermoplastic material. PVC can be used to make §chigh throughput pipes §rand §c§lcircuit boards§r.

First,§b polymerize §rthe Vinyl Chloride to make PVC Solution, then §cdry §rit to make PVC pulps.

§7Iron §rcan be §croasted §rwith §3chlorine §rto get §6Iron (III) Chloride§r, an etching agent for circuit boards.

§6Sodium Bisulfate §rcan be used as an §cetching agent §rto make plastic circuit boards.

§7Integrated Processors §rare the second type of §cMV§r circuits you can make. §rThey're made from §6CPU chips§r, §atransistors§r, §b§6§r§6capacitors§r, §cresistors§r, and red alloy wires.

§6Microprocessors §rare the second type of §cLV §rcircuit that you make. They are made in the same way as Integrated Processors, but using less materials and a copper foil. 

Making these is faster than making LV circuits manually using the traditional process.
An §6inductor§r is a passive electronic component that temporarily stores energy in a magnetic field. It's used in making §cHV processors§r.
The §6Processor Assembly §ris the second type of §cHV Circuit §ryou can make, and it is much faster to make than the §cAdvanced Integrated Circuit§r.
Upgrading your EBF with §62 MV energy hatches §rwill make it possible to smelt stuff at 480 EU/t.
§6Iron, Silicon and Coke §rcan be combined to get ferrosilicon, a material needed for stainless steel.
§6Fluorite Dust §ris also needed to get Stainless Steel, so let's get some.
§cChromite §rcan be roasted to create §6Ferrochrome§r, an impure form of §cchrome§r.

Combine §6Ferrosilicon§r, §cFerrochromium§r, §7Carburized Stainless Steel§r, §aFluorite§r §rand §6Quicklime §rto get Stainless Steel. This process is done in an EBF at 480 EU/t and it produces §cmolten §rstainless steel. 

It has to be run through a §6Fluid Solidifier §rbefore actually using it.
Iron, Nickel and Manganese can be combined in an §6HV EBF §rto create molten §cCarburized Stainless Steel§o§r.
§6Pyrolusite §rcan be smelted in an EBF with Coke to make §6Small Piles of Manganese§r.

Clay§r can be passed through a §aliquid Molecular Sieve §rto make §7Zeolite 13X§r, which can be solidified and then autoclaved to make a §7Zeolite Membrane§r.

You can also use the same method, but with a different §7Circuit §rto produce faster §3Oxygen§r. This process is much more efficient than electrolyzing Water.

A §6reaction furnace§r is a §chigh-temperature vessel§r used in chemical processes to facilitate chemical reactions by providing optimal conditions such as temperature, pressure, and residence time for the desired reactions to occur.
