To get your first computer to run, you will need to first set it up correctly. 

First off, you will need a§6 computer case§r. This is the block which will contain§6 all of the components§r, defining the behavior of the computer you are building.

Upon observing the computer case, you will see §cseveral slots on the right side§r. The tier of the components you can put in there depend on the §atier of the case§r. Most Tier 1 components are MV, while Tier 2 components are HV and Tier 3 components are EV.

Connect your computer to GregTech energy to get it to work.

The §6CPU, or Central Processing Unit§r, serves as the computer's "brain," executing instructions, managing data flow, and coordinating hardware components. 

When you try to start the computer now, it will tell you that §cyou need a CPU§r. These come in 3 different tiers. For CPUs, higher tiers mean §6more components at a time,§r as well as faster execution. For now, you can only use Tier 1 CPUs, as we're at MV.

RAM, or Random Access Memory, is essential for a computer's functioning. It provides fast, temporary storage for data actively used by the CPU. It is volatile memory that is lost when the computer is powered off. 

You will need to insert §7RAM§r into your computer. Higher tiers of memory (RAM) mean §cmore memory available to the programs§r running on your computer. To run §cOpenOS§r, the §doperating system§r, you will want to use at least two §6tier 1 memory (RAM) sticks§r.

There are 6 tiers of memory, from 1 to 3.5.

The analyzer is a handy tool for reading information about computers. Simply §a[Sneak Right Click]§r a block to get some information printed to the chat box. 
This ranges from basic things like the address of components, to power levels in the subnetwork the block is in, and information on a crash, for example.

Right now your computer will crash. Try using the Analyzer to see the error that causes the computer to not boot up: §cno bios found; install configured EEPROM§r.

The §6EEPROM§r is what contains the code used to §6initialize a computer §rwhen it is being booted. 

Since configuring an EEPROM normally requires a computer, you are going to "§3download§o§r" the code from this book! Simply make an empty EEPROM, and you'll receive a configured one by trading with this page.

This page will refresh every 45 seconds.
§c
§lTurning on your computer can be done with the power button on the left.
T.o insert your §6operating system§r, you'll need to place a disk drive next to your case (or connect it via §6cables§r)

The BIOS now is working, but it's §6not finding a file system§r to boot from. You will require an §cOpenOS§r disk to boot into the computer. OpenOS is our operating system.

Since crafting an operating system normally requires a computer, you will just "download" the code from here, like the last page.

The §6cable §rserves as a way of §6connecting computers and machines that are far apart.§r

If you have a compact build where all components touch each other (directly or indirectly, most blocks also behave the same way as cables) you will usually not need cables.

Your computer should be running now, but we want it to show some actual §coutput§r. 

To allow the computer to show some output, you'll want to grab a §6monitor §rand a §6graphics card§r.
On this page, you can "§bdownload§r" some useful OpenComputers programs to floppy disks.

A §6keyboard§r is needed to type text on screens, be they in the world or built into devices such as robots or tablets.

§6Place a keyboard in front of the screen to be able to enter text. §rThe keyboard needs to be facing the screen for it to work.

§6HDDs§o§r, or §cHard Disk Drives§r, are traditional storage devices for computers. They use §brotating magnetic platters to store and retrieve data§r. 

A Hard Disk is required to install OpenOS to the computer. Right now you are booting the computer via the Floppy Disk Drive. By making an HDD and typing §7install §rin the terminal, you'll be able to install OpenOS to the computer.

Once installed to the HDD, the floppy disk is §7no longer necessary.§r 
Additional software is also available as §7floppy disks§r (such as Open Programs Package Manager, or OPPM). They can be obtained via the "§aRepository§r" page.

The §6adapter §rallows computers to interact with other blocks. §6Supported blocks next to the Adapter will show up as components in computers connected to the adapter.
§r
To see devices connected to the computer, open the §cLua interpreter §rby running the command "lua", and then check the list by running "component.list()".

The adapter provides a slot for a few select§7 upgrades§r. For example, the inventory controller upgrade allows computers to query more information from an inventory adjacent to the adapter.

The §9RADAR§r allows detection of entities such as players, mobs or dropped items. 

The built in §9API functions §rreturn a table of names and relative distances of entities within the specified range.

The chat box allows the computer to §7write/read chat messages§.§r. 

For reading or saying messages, a listening distance can be specified (default: 40m). 

This can allow programs on the computer to be triggered from the chatbox, by reading the message contained in the chat_message event.

The §ccipher block§r is used to encrypt and decrypt messages. Items can be placed inside the cipher block to generate the encryption key. 

Messages can then be decrypted using a cipher block with the exact same encryption key. 

For example, encrypted messages can be sent to other computers on a network; the receiving computer will need a cipher block with the same combination of items to decipher the received message. 

The cipher block can be locked via the component API, preventing access to the block's GUI.

You can use a tool called §6LionRay.jar§r to transform audio files into a format called DFPWM. 

To begin, download §bLionRay.jar§r [§9https://github.com/gamax92/LionRay/releases§r], convert the file, and upload it in a cloud service. Then obtain the download address of the file.

To proceed, connect a §6tape drive to your computer§r. You will have access to two commands: "§7tape label§r" and "§7tape write§r". "tape label" is used to name the cassette drive. 

To write the transformed audio file to the tape, use the command "tape write" followed by the download address. 

§cHello Meteor is a very good option for your first cassette tape.

The §6camera block §radds ray casting functionality to computers. 

The §7distance()§r function calculates the distance to the nearest block along the specified ray, which is defined by angles x and y; if no angle is specified, the angle values default to 0. 

Both angles form a frontal cone in front of the camera, with x being the angle on a horizontal plane parallel to the ground, and y, the angle on a vertical plane perpendicular to the ground. If no block exists in the path of the ray, a value of -1 is returned.

The §6Network Card §rallows distant computers connected by §6cable§r to communicate by sending messages to each other. 

You can see the Network Card's documentation here: §9https://ocdoc.cil.li/component:modem

So, you've built your §6first computer §rand wonder what to do with it?

Well, let's start with the good old, proven, beloved §6first program§r. You know which one. First off, let's switch to the /tmp folder, which is a small, writable file system each computer comes with. Remember,§c this gets wiped on reboot, so don't put anything valuable in here! §r

Run the §7"cd /tmp§r" command to change folder.

Type "§7edit <filename>§r", where §7filename§r is the name of the file you wish to edit.

Once in the editor, start coding. In our case it's just the boring, uncreative-but-proven §7print("Hello World!")§r .

When you're done, press §7Ctrl+S§r to save, then press §7Ctrl+W§r to close the editor. 

If you list the contents of the /tmp folder now, you'll see the file has been created. Use the §7ls §rcommand to list the contents of a folder.
§c§l
Teaching an entire programming language is beyond the scope of this guide, so you can look at a tutorial here: http://www.tutorialspoint.com/lua/index.htm

When writing programs you'll usually want to have your programs stick around so the /tmp folder is no long-term solution. 

When you put a §6hard drive§r into a computer it will be automatically mounted in the §6/mnt§r folder, named after the §6first letters of its address§r.

Next, open the computer and run the §7df§r command. This program lists §6all present file systems§r and their current mount points.  
§r
What we want to do now is to§7 assign a name to our hard drive§r. Run §7label §rto get the §cusage information of the labeling program§r. §rYou'll want to get comfortable with following the terminal's instructions, so I won't put everything here.

Once you've named your hard disk, that name is also shown in the hard disk's tooltip. Run §7df§o§r again to verify the hard disk is now named.

We can now§6 mount the hard drive §o§rwhile referring to it by name. Run §7mount§r to mount the hard drive with the specified label at the specified path. 

Hard drives can be §6mounted in multiple locations§r, so doing that will not invalidate the default mount in the /mnt folder. 

Now, computers §6do not store any state across reboots§r. Meaning if your PC crashes, you'll have to mount the hard drive again. So let's make a script that §6mounts the disk for us§r after restarting.

The script has to be named §cautorun.lua §rand has to be in the root folder of the hard drive. Run §7edit autorun.lua §rto edit the file. Here's the code:§7

local fs = require("filesystem")
local proxy = ...
fs.mount(proxy, "test")

§rAfter removing the hard disk from the computer and inserting it again, run§7 ls §rand you should see the disk has been automatically mounted again.

The §cRedstone Card §r§rallows reading and emitting redstone signals around the computer or robot.

The §7Data Card§r provides a variety of data encoding and decoding functionality, hashing, encryption and decryption, etc.

The §bBeep Card §rcard provides the beep() function, which takes a table of frequency-duration pairs as an input, up to eight entries at once. 
The card plays each frequency of beeps for the specified duration. 

The §8Noise Card§r, akin to the beep card, provides the play() function. In addition, it also allows setting each of the eight separate channels' sound modes to make the card play§c square, sine, triangle or sawtooth waves§r.

The §dSound Card §ris a complex device allowing for high-resolution sound synthesis. Similarly to the noise card, it allows generating sound waves of various forms. Documentation on the sound card can be found here: §9https://oc.shadowkat.net/computronics/item/sound_card.md
Now that you've reached HV, we can make §6Tier 2 §rcomputers and components. They can allow up to §7§6Tier 2 CPU and RAM§r, and a variety of new cards.
§6GregTech§r's lamps come in a variety of colors and can be configured to have light, bloom, or both via the circuit in the assembler recipe.

An APU, or §6Accelerated Processing Unit§r, combines a CPU and a GPU into a single device, so you can remove that graphics card and get a new card slot!

Do note that due to the limited space on the chip, a §6Tier 2 §rAPU can only work as fast as a §6Tier 1 CPU §rand only has §6Tier 1 GPU §rgraphics.
Now that you've reached EV, we can make §bTier 3 §rcomputers and components. They can allow up to §bTier 3 CPU and RAM§r, and a variety of new cards, particularly the §cInternet Card§r.

The §7Wireless Network Card§r can transmit packets §6without a cable§r. Wireless packets can not be lost but they may be out of range. 

The §6signal strength§r can be adjusted. Low strength reduces the distance the packets can travel and reduces the power it costs to send them. The maximum strength, by default, is 400.

In general you will want to make sure the line of sight between the sender and receiver is clear.

The §6Audio Cable §rallows you to connect devices which send audio signals to devices which receive and process those. 

An example would be connecting a §6tape drive§r with one or multiple §6speakers§r.
The §6Speaker§r may be connected to audio cables. It will pick up any audio signal sent through the cables and convert it to sound, §cmaking it audible.
The §6Biometric Reader§r sends an event when used by a player, the default event name is bioReader and contains the UUID of the player which used the reader.
The §aKeypad §rhas 9 buttons you can press to raise events to attached computers. You can check the documentation here: §9https://github.com/PC-Logix/OpenSecurity/wiki/Keypad

The §c§4Redstone I/O §rallows reading and emitting redstone signals around the block. 

It can be controlled by any computer the block is connected to. This is basically like an external redstone card.

The §5RFID Reader§r allows you to read RFID Cards in someone's inventory. It can also be added to a §7card §rinto a computer.

The §b§cAlarm §r§rplays a sound when it is activated via redstone or via computer, using the alarm.activate() function.

There are several types of §6switches and gauges §rthat can be used to complement the §6Gregic §raesthetic. Here's a list of them:

Switches

-   Buttons
-   Levers
-   Normal pressure plates ("contact switches")
-   Shock sensitive pressure plates ("contact switches", detect when something/one falls on it)
-   Entity detectors (players, villages, animals, mobs, etc)
-   Block category detectors (e.g. "solid", "ore", "wood", "sapling", "farmland", "water" (includes ice), "liquid", etc)
-   Day timers (06:00 to 24:00)
-   Interval timers (tick based timers)
-   Light sensors ("auto switch" category)
-   Rain sensors ("auto switch" category)
-   Lightning sensors ("auto switch" category)
-   Switch-Link relays (optimized for wireless transmission)
-   Switch-Link receivers (optimized for wireless transmission)
-   Knock sensors (seismic detection of click or breaking an adjacent block)
-  Trapdoor switches (emit a signal and open)

Gauges

-  Analog / digital (show redstone power 0 to 15)
-  LEDs and semaphores ("indicators", show on/off)
-  Alarm lamps (also on/off)
-  Alarm sirens and bells ("sound indicators")
-  Sensitive glass (glass that emits light or changes color)
Vacuum-sealed Brass Drums are required to handle §6§bcryogenic liquids§r.

The §6RAID§r (redundant array of independent disks) houses §b3 Hard Drives§r which will be combined into a single file system. 

This combined file system has is available to all computers connected to the raid. The raid §aonly works when all 3 Drives§r are connected. 

Adding a hard drive to the RAID will §d§d§c§lwipe its contents§r, and removing a hard drive from the RAID will §c§lwipe the entire RAID§r.

§cBreaking a raid block will retain its contents§r, so it can be safely relocated without losing any data.
The §7Portable Tape Drive §rcan be used to play cassettes on the go. So you can play §abattle music §rwhile you're charging at your enemy.

The §6MFU§r acts as a remote adapter.

[§aClick§r] while sneaking onto any side of any block to bind it to a specific position. 

Then, place it into an §6adapter§r nearby (the range is very limited) and it will act §6s if the adapter was placed right next to the specific side§r you bound it to!

Keep in mind that keeping §6the remote adapter connection active uses energy§r.

The §6AR Glasses §rare augmented reality glasses that you can link to a §bcomputer§r

It has a capacity of §c50,000 FE (12,500 EU)§r, which can be increased with upgrades. When you wear the glasses, they consume power at a rate of §c1 FE/tick§r. You can recharge the glasses in any electric device.

The glasses can handle up to §99 different widgets§r. This can be expanded to a maximum of 255 with a Database Upgrade.

By right-clicking on a terminal block, you can establish a connection between the glasses and the terminal.

You need to wear the glasses in the helmet slot.

The §6Electronics Assembler§r is a block from OpenComputers which allows§6 constructing robots and other devices§r from a number of different computer parts. 

The combination of parts which can be made is limited by their §6complexity - the sum of the tiers of all the component parts §r(excluding the CPU and EEPROM). 

How much complexity can be combined is determined by the §bcase §rand the §bCPU§r used.
The §6spoofing card§r acts the same way as a network card, but it allows you to specify the §csource address§r, effectively §amasking the device§r sending the network messages.

The §6Particle Effects Card §rallows computers, robots, and drones to §9create particle effects at a specified location§r, as defined by the coordinates relative to the device. 

The particle name provided to the component API function must be a §avalid particle§r.

§6Tablets §rare built by placing a §6tablet case§r into an assembler, configuring as desired and assembling it. 

Tablets act as §9portable computers§r that cannot directly interact with the world.

The §6tier 2 tablet§r also allows installing §6a single container upgrade§r. The slot provided by the container can be accessed by opening the tablet's alternative GUI, by [§aShift-right click§r]ing with the tablet in hand. This will also forcibly shut down the tablet.

§6Drones§r are built using a §6drone case§r in the assembler. 

They are capable of moving differently and much quicker than robots, and are usually controlled using a client program on a computer. 

The drone will need a§6 configured EEPROM §rto listen for commands to be executed or act on its own.

§6Microcontrollers§r are built using a microcontroller case in the assembler. 

They have less functionality compared to computers, and they can §cnot interact§r with external components. As you can't insert a hard disk drive into a microcontroller, all programming should be done on the §cEEPROM§r.

They have an advantage over computer cases, in that they can also make use of some upgrades, such as the piston upgrade.

The Server Rack §6houses up to 4 Servers§r, which are computers in item format. Its main advantage is the support for §6multiple Component Buses§r, enabling control of more components than a normal computer.

In addition, the Server Rack §6acts as a Power Distributor and Switch§r. Each server slot can be configured to §6connect to one side directly§r.

The Server Rack can also §6house a Terminal Server§r, which enables a §6Remote Terminal to connect wirelessly§r. It can accommodate up to §6four Remote Terminals at a time§r.

On the left, there are §6four slots for components§r, where only Servers and Terminal Servers can be placed. 
The middle section consists of §6five vertical lines§r, each corresponding to a side of the rack (excluding the front).

When a server is inserted, a §6'primary' node§r is added to each vertical line. Clicking on one of these nodes §6connects the Server to the side of the case controlled by that line§r. If the server contains a Network Card, §6smaller nodes§r are created under the primary node for each network card present. Clicking on these smaller nodes §6connects the network card to a side of the case§r, allowing communication through the network side.

The Server Rack has a §6'Relay Mode' button§r in its GUI. When §6enabled§r, modem messages and power pass through the rack like a cable. When §6disabled§r, different networks on different sides remain isolated.

To access servers inside the case, §6right-click on them in the front of the Server Rack§r. This opens their component view. To reopen the Server Rack GUI, §6right-click on the side of the Server Rack§r or above/below any installed Servers.

Wired network messages can be sent §6between Servers with Network Cards§r. These Network Cards must be §6configured in the Server Rack GUI§r to share a side. The §6unused side of the case§r is ideal for Server-Server internal networking without cross-talk outside the case.

Additionally, the Server Rack features a §6Relay Mode§r, which §6repeats wired network packets to external components connected to the rack block§r.

Unlike computers, §6robots§r§r can move around and interact with the world much like a player can.

They §d§ccan not interact with external components§r, however! If you need to communicate with a computer or other robots, use a§6 Wireless Network Card§r.

§6Robots are built by placing a Computer Case in an Assembler. 
§r
You can check the Robot API here: §9https://ocdoc.cil.li/api:robot

A §6Server§r can contain components like a Computer Case. 

Open a§6 Server §rby having it selected in your hotbar and§  [§aRight Click§r]ing. A configured server can be placed into a §6server rack§r, where it can then be powered on and perform like a normal computer. 

Servers can be controlled using a §6Remote Terminal§r, which will act like a portable §6Screen+Keyboard combo§r for the server.

The §6Terminal Serve§rr can be bound to §6remote terminals§r which provides a remote accessible tier 3 screen and keyboard. 

Terminal servers need to share a §6configured side§r (see the rack gui) with a server blade to be connected. Terminal servers have a range limit equal to a tier 2 wireless card.

The §7Light Board§r can be put into §6Server Racks§r. It provides 4 §cindicator lights§r which connected computers are able to control using the provi§7ded light_board§r component.

If you interact with the board using §6any type of wrench§r, you can §6change its layout§r. Note that this resets the color settings.

The §6Switch Board §rcan be put into Server Racks. 

It has 4§6 clickable switches§r in the front which can be checked and activated using the §7switch_board§r component. 
In addition, it fires a §7switch_flipped §revent whenever a switch is manually or automatically flipped.

With a simple command, this amazing device will wipe clean the contents of the server rack and any connected devices after a specified duration. 

§6This device can be used with the explode floppy disk§r which allows for convenient and highly configurable self-destruction.

The §6Geolyzer§r scans its surroundings for the§c hardness §rof blocks. It can scan up to§6 32m §rup and down.

The returned values are the hardness values of the scanned blocks. 

This is useful for §6detecting ores§r (which are usually harder than stone) and for generating 'maps' that can be displayed on the Hologram Projector. 

You can find more about its API here:§9 https://ocdoc.cil.li/component:geolyzer
The §6Motion Sensor§r allows detecting movement of entities, as long as a direct line of sight is given. You can find more about the API here: §9https://ocdoc.cil.li/component:motion_sensor

The §6Waypoint§r provides functionality for robots and drones with a navigation upgrade. 

The position reported is the block directly in front of the waypoint, as indicated by the particle effects. This allows the waypoint block to be placed above a §6chest§r, for instance, to be able to determine the position of the block directly above the chest.

Waypoints can be labeled and provided with a §credstone signal§r. 

The waypoint block can be located using the §7findWaypoints()§r function in the navigation component. This allows the robots or drone to find all waypoints within a certain range; the function returns the label of the waypoint, the position of the waypoint in relative coordinates, as well as the redstone level of the waypoint.

The advanced cipher block uses §6RSA encryption§r by creating a §6public§r and §cprivate §rkey pair. 

The§6 key pair§r can be generated using a pair of prime numbers or randomly. 

The returned value itself will return both key pairs once it is done generating (which will take a few seconds). 

The public key is used to encrypt messages, while the private key is used to decrypt messages. Only devices with access to the private key may decrypt messages.

The §3Hologram Projector§r projects a hologram in the area over it. 

The size of the hologram can be scaled from 1x1x1 to 9x9x6.

The number of 'voxels' will stay the same, regardless of scale though. It has resolution of 48x32x48 monochrome voxels (they can either be on or off). 

The second tier of the hologram projector is also capable of displaying colored voxels.

The §2Cleanroom§r is a hollow multiblock free of contaminants. Most new circuit-related recipes, as well as some unique things like §3§r, will need to be run in machines inside a Cleanroom. 

Once built, the Cleanroom must be well-maintained and powered for a while to clean the inside all the way to §6100%§r. The Cleanroom's power draw will decrease once it fully cleans itself. 

Processes requiring the Cleanroom will §conly§r run when inside a §c100% cleaned§r Cleanroom; if not, the recipe will not start, or recipe progress might be lost. 

The Cleanroom can be built in any size between 5x5x5 and 15x15x15. The Controller is placed in the center of the top face, and the rest of the top face is built from §3Filter Casings§r. The rest of the wall space is filled with §3Plascrete§r or §3Cleanroom Glass§r. Glass can not be placed on the edges§r.

For transfer between the clean environment and the outside world:
- Items and fluids through §3Passthrough Hatches§r. They automatically input from one side and output from the opposite side.
- Energy through §bGregTech §3Hulls§r or §3Diodes§r (of any tier). Note that Diodes can transport up to §e16 amps§r, whilst Hulls can only transport §e1 amp§r.
- Players through an §I§7Iron Door§r. The room remains clean when doors are opened.

You will also need an §3Energy §rand §3Maintenance Hatch §rfor cleaning. §3

§rThe wall space must be at least 75% §3Plascrete§r or §3Cleanroom Glass§r. 
The floor block directly under the controller must also be §3Plascrete§r or §3Cleanroom Glass§r.
GT generators and Muffler Hatches are §cnot allowed§r in Cleanrooms.

Using some fancy chemicals you've unlocked recently, you can concentrate impure ore dusts using §6Froth Flotation.§f §cClarifiers§f may also be needed for some concentration processes.

This will be needed to process certain rare ore dusts, but you can use froth flotation to get §cdouble§f the ores out of other impure ore dusts. Chemicals used will vary by ore. Use JEI.

Froth Flotation involves taking impure ore and turning it into a slurry. This slurry is then placed in a§6 froth flotation machine§r. Inside the machine, bubbles are created with the help of a substance called§b frother§r. These bubbles have collector molecules on their surfaces, which attract and bind to the ore particles.

As a result, the ore particles rise to the top of the machine along with the bubbles. If needed, §cactivators§r are used to enhance the binding of the ore particles with the collectors. On the other hand, §edepressants§r are used to deactivate unwanted gangue particles and prevent them from binding to the collectors on the bubbles.

§7Polytetrafluoroethylene§r is an important polymer (plastic) because it cannot react to most chemicals. 

It is required for §6large chemical reactors§r, making it a necessity in later voltages. It is polymerized from §6tetrafluoroethylene§r. To produce tetrafluoroethylene, the following processes are used.

50L Methane + 250L Chlorine in a CSTR will produce a 200L of a §6chlorinated methane mixture§r.

Distilling 4000L of this mixture in a tower will produce:
250L Carbon Tetrachloride
250L Chloroform
250L Dichloromethane
250L Chloromethane
2500L Hydrogen Chloride

§6Chloroform (CHCl3) §ris what we want to use to produce §6tetrafluoroethylene§r. In order to convert some of the lesser chlorinated products such as Chloromethane and Dichloromethane, you can react those chemicals with more chlorine and distill the products to get more chloroform.

100L of Hydrogen Fluoride and 50L of Chloroform in a §cCSTR§r produces 150L of §6Acidic Chlorodifluoromethane§r. 

Pyrolysis of 6000L of Acidic Chlorodifluoromethane produces 5000L of §6Acidic Tetrafluoroethylene§r.

Centrifuging 5000L of Acidic Tetrafluoroethylene with 4000L of water will produce 1000L of §6Tetrafluoroethylene§r and 4000L of Hydrochloric Acid.

Now it is time to §6polymerize the tetrafluoroethylene§r. 

The Fluorinated Detergent Mixture is produced from 26 §6PFOA (perfluorooctanoic acid) dust§r and 1000L of water. 

We produce 2000L of §6Tetrafluoroethylene Emulsion §rfrom 1000L of Tetrafluoroethylene and 1000L of Fluorinated Detergent Mixture. 

then, we take 1000L of this emulsion and 1 Tiny Potassium Persulfate Dust in a §cpolymerization tank §rto produce 2000L of §6Polytetrafluoroethylene Solution§r, which is dried to produce §l§c§l7 PTFE Dust§r and 1000L of Fluorinated Detergent Mixture§r, so you can loop the mixture back into the processing line.
The §6Elytra §ris made with PTFE and is a good alternative to §cjetpack flight.

§6Ethanol §rgoes in a§c reaction furnace§r to produce §bImpure Diethyl Ether§r, which is §cdistilled §r§rto make §bDiethyl Ether.
§r
Diethyl Ether, Ethylene and Trialkylaluminium are combined in a §cbatch reactor§r and then §cdistilled§r to make§6 Aluminium Alkoxide Mixture§r. This also makes Diethyl Ether again that you can loop back into the line.

Aluminium Alkoxide Mixture is §ccombined§r to make a §6Ziegler Alcohol Mixture§r.

§lIMPORTANT: YOU DO NOT NEED TO AUTOMATE THIS, THIS IS A ONE TIME PROCESS AS YOU CAN RECYCLE P.F.O.A.

3000L §6N-octanol §r+ 16 Chromium Trioxide Dust + 6000L Sulfuric Acid --> 3000L §6Caprylic (octanoic) acid§r + 1000L §6Chromium Sulfate Solution§r in a §cBatch Reactor§r.

50L §6Caprylic acid§r + 50L §6Thionyl Chloride§r §c-->§r 50L §6Diluted Octanoyl Chloride §r+ 50L Sulfur Dioxide + 50L Hydrogen Chloride

3000L §6Diluted Octanoyl Chloride§r, when §cdistilled§r, will produce 1000L of §6Octanoyl Chloride§r, 1000L of Water, and 1000L of Pyridine.

50L of§6 Octanoyl Chloride§r + 750L of Hydrofluoric Acid§c --> §r800L of §6Fluorinated Octanoyl Chloride§r + 750L Hydrogen + 750L water

§cDistillation§r of 16000L Fluorinated Octanoyl Chloride will produce 2400L of§6 Perfluorooctanoyl Fluoride§r. §cReact 1:1 with water§r to produce §6PFOA solution§r, which is further §cdistilled§r§r.

For stronger coolants, refrigerants will not be enough to provide the cooling needed to liquify gases.

The tube furnace is specifically used to synthesize certain superconducting materials.
Hydrogen becomes a liquid at 14 Kelvin. This is low enough to activate HV superconductors.

Mercury Barium Calcium Cuprate is a mixture of the oxides of mercury, barium, calcium and copper. This isn't too advanced to make though.

Very Concentrated Brine is reacted with §7Hydrochloric Acid §rto make §6Boron-Free Brine§r.
Boron-Free Brine is reacted with §9Sodium Carbonate§r to make §2Lithium-Free Brine§r.
§3Chlorine §ris bubbled into Lithium-Free Brine to make §1§2Chlorinated Brine§r, which is then vacuum ejected to make §4Bromine§r.

All of the fluid deposits in the Nether are §clava fluid deposits.§f Using a §afluid drilling rig§f and a §bheat exchanger,§f you can turn water into steam using lava.

This steam can then be used to generate power.

Silicon dioxide wafers are the base of many complex semiconductor-based technologies, such as NAND wafers for EV-tier circuits.

This is only the beginning.

Putting the sulfuric oil residue in a vacuum distillation tower gives 3 new oil fractions: Bituminous Residue, Slack Wax, and Lubricating Oil.

§6Lubricating Oil §rcan be upgraded into lighter fractions, or mixed with additives to create lubricant.

§6Slack Wax§r can be treated to create paraffin wax, which has several uses including making treated wood.

§2Bituminous residue§r will be explored in the page to the left.

Tired of §6refinery gas?§f You can react refinery gas with sulfuric acid to alkylate it, followed by distillation to obtain §9gasoline.§f

This can also be done with §9natural gas.

Some oil fractions such as Fuel Oil are too heavy to be cracked for useful chemicals.

Although fuel oil can be burnt, it's not as good for energy production as the lighter oil fractions.

Luckily, the heavier oil fractions can be upgraded by cracking them in an oil cracker with a cracking catalyst. Centrifuging the upgraded fuel mix gives a lighter oil fraction, as well as a spent catalyst. This is put in an EBF with some oxygen to return the reusable catalyst.
Using a Coking Tower and a Rotary Kiln, bituminous residue can be turned into useful coke dust. Green coke is an intermediate.
HV Sensors will be needed in several advanced pieces of technology.
To make Gallium Phosphide crystals, you need to make Ammonium Dihydrogen Phosphate using the Batch Reactor, and Gallium Trioxide by roasting Gallium.
The HV-Tier prospector has greater range, but more importantly, it has the ability to §6scan for fluid deposits,§f which is something the LV-Tier prospector can't do.

There are HV versions of the 3 battery types introduced in MV: Lithium, Sodium, and Cadmium. HV batteries are made the same way, just with a slightly higher material cost.

Cadmium is unlocked at this tier.

With HV batteries, you can make HV-tier electrical tools using HV power units.
HV Sensors can also be used to create the §6Nature's Compass,§f which can point you in the direction of any biome you specify.
Using chrome-based catalysts and propene from oil, you can create polypropylene, which is needed in HEPA filters for your cleanroom.
Using an ion implanter and a high-purity group 13 element (like boron or aluminium), you can n-dope silicon wafers. This requires a cleanroom.
This wafer is a stepping stone to create the NAND wafer, which you will need for making your first EV circuits.

Chemical Vapor Deposition, or CVD for short, is a way to deposit chemicals onto wafers to create microscopic structures.

This will be especially useful in your quest to make increasingly powerful electronics.

Silane will be needed in several CVD processes in semiconductor fabrication. This can be made from several steps of disproportionation and distillation. Use JEI. The process will require §63 Distilleries and 3 Fixed Bed Reactors§r to turn Trichlorosilane into Silane.
Behold, the NAND wafer. A well-earned technological achievement.
Make the Workstation, from NAND wafers, HV circuits, and several other things. This is your first EV circuit.
Make the HV Circuit Assembler, which will probably be useful soon.

Now that you are at HV, you can make more advanced types of §cexplosives §rand §cmissiles §rby putting HV power on a Weapons Factory.

There are 3 new types of explosives:
§7Endothermic explosives§r, made with cryogenics
§3Exothermic explosives§r, made with ethylene oxide
§aEMP explosives§r, made with superconductors

You can get most of the ingredients for these at HV.
Remember that these are Tier 3 missiles, so you will need a T3 missile launching station for them to work.
No Description
§9Nichrome Coils§f can go all the way up to a whopping §c3,600 Kelvin.

As you may have noticed, §6cupronickel coils§f are not the only way to heat your EBF. This quest asks you to obtain §9Kanthal Coils,§f which are able to heat your EBF to §c2,700 Kelvin.§f This is necessary for smelting materials with a higher melting point, such as §dTitanium.§f

Running smelting recipes at a much higher temperature than what is required will also provide Overclock Bonuses. §aHover over the EBF for more details.§f

These new coils can also be used on Multi Smelters, Pyrolyse Ovens and Oil Crackers for efficiency boosts. §aPress shift while hovering over the coils for more details.

When smelting at higher temperatures, you will also need to somehow cool the resulting §cHot Ingots.§f That is what  the §aQuencher§f is for.

Simply provide a coolant like §bwater§f or even §bair,§f and the hot ingot will be quenched to form a normal ingot.
The Fluidized Bed Reactor will also be needed to carry out some more advanced §ccatalyzed §rchemical processes later on.
XNet systems are a powerful tool for early game automation.

The Modular Storage from RFTools is a rather useful block for storing and organizing your items.

It even comes with a search bar for stored items.

It requires Storage Modules before you can start storing things in it.

Using a Distillation Tower, you can get more out of coal tar, including §6Aniline, B.T.E.X. (Benzene, Toluene, Ethylbenzene, Xylene), Pyridine,§f and much more.

Those products will be useful in chemical manufacturing, so it's recommended that you set up a coal tar processing line soon.

Steam cracking oil fractions and distilling it gives you §aButadiene.§f This, along with styrene made from §aEthylbenzene,§f will allow you to make §9Styrene-Butadiene Rubber.§f

It can do all the things that Rubber can in recipes, but at a lower cost in assembling recipes.

In case you missed it, §6Silicone Rubber§f is the other higher tier rubber available at HV.

You will need §3n-Butyllithium§f in the first place as a catalyst to make this.

n-Butyllithium requires a solution of Lithium and Diethyl Ether, and also Bromobutane, which is made by combining Hydrobromic Acid and n-Butanol from the Ziegler Process. 

Hydrobromic Acid is made in a CSTR by combining Sulfur Dioxide, Water and Bromine.
uu

Tired of using Latex and Coagulation Tanks for precious rubber?

Isoprene from §6Steam-Cracked Naphtha§f specifically can be polymerized for §cPolyisoprene,§f which can be vulcanized the same way as Latex for Rubber.

A Fluidized Bed Reactor allows you to create §dPolydimethylsiloxane,§f which can be vulcanized to create §cSilicone Rubber.§f

It can do all the things that Rubber can in recipes, but at a lower cost in assembling recipes.

In case you missed it, §6Styrene-Butadiene Rubber§f is the other higher tier rubber available at HV.

The items required are §6Chloromethane §r(you should already have this), Copper Oxide and Silicon, as well as Potassium Persulfate. Since we're now in HV, the quests will no longer list every single step in a chemical process.
Ziegler-Natta Catalysts, which require Titanium Tetrachloride, can boost the speed and production of several polymerization processes, such as making polyethylene and polyisoprene.

As you may have noticed, moving up in tiers causes your energy consumption to increase exponentially.

To deal with this, it may be time to start adding §cfuel additives§f to the gasoline/diesel you've been using to power your base.

There will be §63 tiers of gasolines §rbeyond the normal gasoline. The first tier can be made by mixing gasoline with §6any 2 §rof the following. The second tier will require §63§r of the following. The final, highest tier of gasoline will require all§6 4§r:

- Oxygenates
- Antioxidants
- Antiknock Agents
- General Fuel Additive

Each of these are their own fluid. They are made from any two chemicals from their respective categories:

List of §3oxygenates§r:

- Ethanol
- Methanol
- n-butanol
- tert-Butyl Alcohol
- Isopropyl alcohol
- Ethyl tert butyl ether

List of §bantioxidants§r:

- Butylated hydroxytoluene
- 2,4-Dimethyl-6-tert-butylphenol
- 2,6-Di-tert-butylphenol
- p-Phenylenediamine
- Ethylenediamine

List of §cantiknock agents§r:

- Toluene
- Isooctane
- Tetraethyllead
- Ferrocene

List of §dgeneral fuel additives§r:

- Acetone
- Diethyl ether
- Nitromethane

§6Cetane-boosted diesel§r can be made by mixing diesel or biodiesel with any 2 of the following:

- Tetranitromethane
- 2-ethylhexyl nitrate
- di-tert-butyl peroxide
A rotary kiln is a large, cylindrical, rotating furnace-like structure that applies heat to materials by constantly §crotating them§r.
Due to the immense amount of chemicals required for §6floth frotation§r, they may not be covered in this chapter. For more info on froth flotation, look at the Periodic Table chapter.

With Energy, Items, and a specified Recipe, RFTools Autocrafters can automatically craft stuff for you.

GT Wirse/Cables are compatible with RF machines, so don't worry about having to convert energy.

These can come in handy if you dont want to make a GT Packager to deal with tiny dusts or small dusts.
§6Chainmail armor §rcan be made by combining several §airon rings.
§6Iron Armor §ris a little harder to make than chainmail, requiring §cleather§r, but it offers better protection.
§7§7§6TechGuns doors §rcan supplement your §6G§cr§6e§cg§6i§cc§r gigafactory.
You can use your Weapons Factory to build §6Stick and Frag Grenades §rthat do quite a bit of damage.
Hydrogen + Nitric Oxide can be combined to make §aHydroxylamine§r. Nitric Oxide can be made in a variety of ways, check JEI.

§lNylon§r or polycaprolactam is an advanced polymer that can be used to make advanced suits and armor.

This is how you make it:

Hydroxylamine + Cyclohexanone -> Cyclohexanone Oxime

Cyclohexanone Oxime Dust + Sulfuric Acid -> Caprolactam Solution 

Ammonia Solution + Caprolactam Solution -> Extracted Caprolactam Solution

Extracted Caprolactam Solution -> Caprolactam

Caprolactam -> Polycaprolactam

§6Cyclohexanone §rcan be made with the following process:

Benzene + Hydrogen -> Cyclohexane
Oxygen + Cyclohexane -> Diluted Cyclohexanone
Diluted Cyclohexanone -> Cyclohexanone

Raney Nickel can be used as a catalyst in chemical reactions.

Nickel + Small Pile of Zinc + Aluminium ->§  §5Raney Nickel§r
Raney Nickel + Sodium Hydroxide -> §7Activated Raney Nickel
§bHeavy Cloth §ris made with Nylon§r and can be used to make several varieties of armor.
You can make Soldier Armor with Heavy Cloth.
Combining Combat Armor with some leather gives §9Ranger's Armor§r.
You can use Heavy Cloth to make Combat Armor.

The §6Riot Shield§r is stronger than a regular shield and can resist damage from different types of firearms.

However, it doesn't provide a high level of damage reduction. While wearing the Shield, you can only wield §cone-handed weapons§r that are less effective in combat.
Using an §6Autoclave§r, Polyethylene §rand some Carbon you can make Carbon Fibers. You can §ccompress §rthem to make a Carbon Fiber Mesh.
The §7Ballistic Shield§r has a higher level of damage reduction for various firearms and other types of damage, but it can still only be equipped with one-handed weapons.
The §6Upgrade Bench §rupgrades your armor using §6Armor Upgrades§r. They can be made of steel, and later on, advanced plastics.
The§a Repair Bench §rcan be used to repair weapons and armour.
No Description

§6Vaults§f from §cMultiStorage§f provide safe storage for your valuables.

They are made from Vault Wall Blocks and a Vault Door, and have a minimum size of 4x4x4 on the outside, or 2x2x2 on the inside.

If you want to, you can put ports in the wall to allow for energy, fluids and items passing in and out.

The §3Multi Smelter§r is a 3x3x3 multiblock machine capable of §esmelting huge amounts of items per second§r. 

By upgrading its coils and power tier, it can become capable of smelting several thousands of items per second.

The most basic Multi Smelter essentially does 32 items in the same time as a furnace does one. With a set of §6Tungstensteel§r coil blocks, that jumps to 128 items per operation. 

The Multi Smelter requires §a8 coil blocks§r, §a1 input bus§r, §a1 output bus§r, and §21 maintenance hatch§r, §21 muffler hatch§r, and at least §a1 energy hatch§r, all of any tier.

As you find more resources around the world, you'll find that you'll have to somehow transport them back to your main base. The main method of linking separate bases at this point are Trains.

Trains are made using the Railroad Engineering Station. In order to actually form the multiblock, you will need to cover the middle 3 rows of the concrete floor of the Station with Immersive Railroading Tracks, which will be explained further in a later quest. The concrete blocks in the center row of the floor are replacable with any block, including pipes or air, so that you can easily interact with any trains spawned by the Station.

Keep in mind that the Railroad Engineering Station does not make a train item that you can simply drag into your inventory. §6The multiblock spawns a train entity on the center rails§f when provided with the needed items to construct a train. Check JEI to see what trains you can build.

Every Train needs an Engine. Your first available train is the Monorail, powered by the Monorail Engine. Make one.

Note: Due to JEI being bad with NBT, clicking on the monorail engine will show how to make the monorail engine, the monorail tank, the monorail freight and the monorail passanger. Just scroll through until you see the recipe for the actual monorail engine.

Track Augments include the Detector, Locomotive Control, Item Loader/Unloader, Fluid Loader/Unloader, Speed Retarder, and Coupler. They are very useful when it comes to automating Train logistics.

Right click on a track segment with the augment to apply the augment. Augments can be removed from the track by right clicking them with the Large Wrench.

There's a lot of information on how to use the augments, so for brevity we will simply link the Immersive Railroading wiki. Scroll down to the "Augments" section to view the pages about Augments.

§9https://github.com/TeamOpenIndustry/ImmersiveRailroading/wiki

If Drums aren't good enough for your storage needs, then look no further than the Steel Multiblock Tank. It can hold 1,000 buckets, or 1,000,000 L of any fluid, as long as its temperature isn't ridiculously high (as in 2,000 Kelvin high)

You can use Steel Tank Valves to get fluids in or out of the tank.

Right clicking an Engine makes you go inside, allowing you to drive the train.

By default, you use the keypad to control the train. You can change this in Options > Controls. If you want to keep it that way, you will need NumLock enabled for the keypad to work.

The controls, as well as further instructions, can be seen here: §9https://github.com/TeamOpenIndustry/ImmersiveRailroading/wiki/Driving-Diesel-Locomotives

Only Engines need to be fueled before they can work. They can be fueled by two ways:

1. Right clicking the Engine to enter, and then right clicking again to open the fuel GUI, which you can use to add fuel or remove fuel

2. Having the Engine pass over a Fluid Loader, which can automatically add fuel to the Engine

The following fuels can be used to fuel the Engine:
- Diesel
- Gasoline
- Naphtha
- Fuel Oil
- Kerosene
- Biodiesel
- Cetane-Boosted Diesel
- Midgrade Gasoline
- Premium Gasoline
- Supreme Gasoline

There are also Monorail Tanks, Monorail Freights, and Monorail Passenger Chaircars. They are made similarly to the Monorail Engine, and can be connected to the Engine by simply having them bump into each other on a track.

The Monorail Tank can store 2,500 buckets, or 2,500,000 L of any liquid. They can be interacted with using Fluid Loaders/Unloaders, or by Shift+Right Clicking the Tank to open a GUI for adding or removing fluids.

The Monorail Freight can store 6,400 items. They can be interacted with using Item Loaders/Unloaders, or by Shift+Right Clicking the Tank to open a GUI for adding or removing items.

Right clicking a Monorail Passenger Chaircar makes you go inside. You can move around.

This item is used to check the coupling status of stock and set the coupling mode.

Right clicking on a piece of rolling stock near a coupler will tell you where it is coupled to and the current coupling mode.

Shift + right clicking on a piece of rolling stock near a coupler will set the coupler mode.
- §6Shunting mode§f means that the cars can bump into each other, but they won't couple.
- §6Normal mode§f means that when cars bump into each other they will couple and form a train.

With an OpenComputers system (unlocked in MV) and a Train Radio-Control Card, you can control Trains from the comfort of your base.

To use the Radio-control Card, it must first be linked with locomotive. Right-clicking a locomotive will link the card to it. Shift-Right-clicking unlinks the card.

Once the Card is linked (which will also be stated on the item tooltip), the Card needs to be placed into a Tier 0 or higher slot in any OpenComputers computer. The Card can then be polled by the computer with the component name "ir_remote_control". If you are not sure how this is done, consult the OpenComputers Wiki.

The Card can now control the train in a similar fashion to the Locomotive Control Augment. The supported functions are
- setThrottle(number): Sets the throttle to a value between -1 and 1 (reverse/forward)
- setBrake(number): Sets the brake to a value between 0 and 1
- horn(): fires off the locomotive's horn
- bell(): rings the locomotive bell
- getPos(): returns the locomotive's world position
- getLinkUUID(): returns the UUID of the linked loco

An important thing to take care of is that the Card has a limited range and power cost. By default, the range is 500m, and the EU cost per metre is 0.

Asphalt can be made by putting Bituminous Residue in a Rotary Kiln, mixing the resulting Bitumen with oil, and centrifuging the Bitumen Solution to extract some extra oil, leaving behind Asphalt. This can be used to make Asphalt blocks, which have the same speed boost as concrete.
